translations.english: If a devotee offers Me with **love** a leaf, a flower, a fruit, or water, **I accept that offering** made with devotion by one of pure mind.

verses.original:
यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत् ।
यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम् ॥ २७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yat karoṣhi yad aśhnāsi yaj juhoṣhi dadāsi yat |
yat tapasyasi kaunteya tat kuruṣhva mad-arpaṇam || 27 ||

translations.english: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer in sacrifice, whatever you give away, and whatever austerities you perform, O son of Kunti, **do that as an offering to Me**.

verses.original:
शुभाशुभफलैरेवं मोक्ष्यसे कर्मबन्धनैः ।
संन्यासयोगयुक्तात्मा विमुक्तो मामुपैष्यसि ॥ २८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhubhāśhubha-phalair evaṁ mokṣhyase karma-bandhanaiḥ |
sannyāsa-yoga-yuktātmā vimukto mām upaiṣhyasi || 28 ||

translations.english: Thus, you will be freed from the bondage of actions, which bear good and bad results. With your mind established in the **yoga of renunciation (sannyāsa yoga)**, you will be liberated and come to Me.

verses.original:
समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रियः ।
ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम् ॥ २ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
samo 'haṁ sarva-bhūteṣhu na me dveṣhyo 'sti na priyaḥ |
ye bhajanti tu māṁ bhaktyā mayi te teṣhu chāpy aham || 29 ||

translations.english: **I am equal toward all beings**; there is no one hateful or dear to Me. But those who worship Me with devotion **dwell in Me, and I also dwell in them**.

verses.original:
अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो भजते मामनन्यभाक् ।
साधुरेव स मन्तव्यः सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि सः ॥ ३० ॥
verses.transliteration:
api chet su-durāchāro bhajate mām ananya-bhāk |
sādhur eva sa mantavyaḥ samyag vyavasito hi saḥ || 30 ||

translations.english: Even if a person commits the most abominable action, if he is engaged in My devotional service with unwavering focus, **he is to be considered righteous**, for he is rightly situated in his determination.

verses.original:
क्षिप्रं भवति धर्मात्मा शश्वच्छान्तिं निगच्छति ।
कौन्तेय प्रतिजानीहि न मे भक्तः प्रणश्यति ॥ ३ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
kṣhipraṁ bhavati dharmātmā śhaśhvach chhāntiṁ nigachchhati |
kaunteya pratijānīhi na me bhaktaḥ praṇaśhyati || 31 ||

translations.english: He quickly becomes righteous (**dharmātmā**) and attains lasting peace. O son of Kunti, declare this boldly: **My devotee is never destroyed**.

verses.original:
मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्युः पापयोनयः ।
स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम् ॥ ३२ ॥
verses.transliteration:
māṁ hi pārtha vyapāśhritya ye 'pi syuḥ pāpa-yonayaḥ |
striyo vaiśhyās tathā śhūdrās te 'pi yānti parāṁ gatim || 32 ||

translations.english: O son of Pṛthā, even those who may be born of lower origin—women, vaiśhyas (merchants), as well as śhūdras (laborers)—by **taking shelter of Me**, they too attain the supreme destination.

verses.original:
किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणाः पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा ।
अनित्यमसुखं लोकमिमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम् ॥ ३ ३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
kiṁ punar brāhmaṇāḥ puṇyā bhaktā rājarṣhayas tathā |
anityam asukhaṁ lokam imaṁ prāpya bhajasva mām || 33 ||

translations.english: How much more certainly, then, the pious brāhmaṇas and devoted royal sages (**rājarṣhayas**)! Having come to this temporary, miserable world, **engage in loving service to Me**.

verses.original:
मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु ।
मामेवैष्यसि युक्त्वैवमात्मानं मत्परायणः ॥ ३४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
man-manā bhava mad-bhakto mad-yājī māṁ namaskuru |
mām evaiṣhyasi yuktvai-vam ātmānaṁ mat-parāyaṇaḥ || 34 ||

translations.english: **Fix your mind upon Me**, be devoted to Me, worship Me, and offer homage to Me. Being completely absorbed in Me, having Me as your supreme goal, you shall come to Me.

chapters.name: Vibhūti Yoga: The Yoga of Divine Glories
chapters.summary: Krishna describes the extent of His opulence (Vibhūti), explaining that He is the source of all spiritual and material worlds and that all wondrous phenomena in existence are merely partial manifestations of His infinite power and glory.

verses.original:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वचः ।
यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया ॥ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
bhūya eva mahā-bāho śhṛṇu me paramaṁ vachaḥ |
yat te 'haṁ prīyamāṇāya vakṣhyāmi hita-kāmyayā || 1 ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: Listen again, O mighty-armed (Arjuna), to My supreme word, which I shall speak to you for your welfare, because you are very dear to Me.

verses.original:
न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः ।
अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वशः ॥ २ ॥
verses.transliteration:
na me viduḥ sura-gaṇāḥ prabhavaṁ na maharṣhayaḥ |
aham ādir hi devānāṁ maharṣhīṇāṁ cha sarvaśhaḥ || 2 ||

translations.english: Neither the multitude of demigods nor the great sages (maharṣhis) know My origin or opulence, for I am the source of the demigods and the great sages in all respects.

verses.original:
यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम् ।
असम्मूढः स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ॥ ३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yo mām ajam anādiṁ cha vetti loka-maheśhvaram |
asammūḍhaḥ sa martyeṣhu sarva-pāpaiḥ pramuchyate || 3 ||

translations.english: He who knows Me as the **unborn** (aja), without beginning (anādi), and the **Supreme Lord** of the worlds (loka-maheśhvaram)—that unbewildered mortal is freed from all sins.

verses.original:
बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसंमोहः क्षमा सत्यं दमः शमः ।
सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च ॥ ४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
buddhir jñānam asaṁmohaḥ kṣhamā satyaṁ damaḥ śhamaḥ |
sukhaṁ duḥkhaṁ bhavo 'bhāvo bhayaṁ chābhayam eva cha || 4 ||

translations.english: **Intelligence**, **knowledge**, freedom from doubt, **forgiveness**, truthfulness, control of the senses, control of the mind, pleasure, pain, birth, death, **fear**, and **fearlessness**—

verses.original:
अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयशः ।
भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधाः ॥ ५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
ahiṁsā samatā tuṣhṭis tapo dānaṁ yaśho 'yaśhaḥ |
bhavanti bhāvā bhūtānāṁ matta eva pṛthag-vidhāḥ || 5 ||

translations.english: —non-violence, impartiality, contentment, austerity, charity, fame, and infamy—all these diverse qualities of living beings **originate from Me alone**.

verses.original:
महर्षयः सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा ।
मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः ॥ ६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
maharṣhayaḥ sapta pūrve chatvāro manavas tathā |
mad-bhāvā mānasā jātā yeṣhāṁ loka imāḥ prajāḥ || 6 ||

translations.english: The **seven great sages** (Maharṣhis) of the past, and the **four Manus**, whose mind and being are imbued with My nature, were born from My mind. From them came all the living beings in this world.

verses.original:
एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः ।
सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशयः ॥ ७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
etāṁ vibhūtiṁ yogaṁ cha mama yo vetti tattvataḥ |
so 'vikampena yogena yujyate nātra saṁśhayaḥ || 7 ||

translations.english: One who genuinely knows this **opulence** (**vibhūti**) and mystic power (**yoga**) of Mine becomes endowed with unwavering **Yoga** (steadfast devotion). There is no doubt about this.

verses.original:
अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते ।
इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः ॥ ८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
ahaṁ sarvasya prabhavo mattaḥ sarvaṁ pravartate |
iti matvā bhajante māṁ budhā bhāva-samanvitāḥ || 8 ||

translations.english: **I am the source of all spiritual and material worlds**. Everything emanates from Me. The wise who perfectly know this engage in My devotional service with deep conviction.

verses.original:
मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्तः परस्परम् ।
कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च ॥ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
mach-chittā mad-gata-prāṇā bodhayantaḥ parasparam |
kathayantaśh cha māṁ nityaṁ tuṣhyanti cha ramanti cha || 9 ||

translations.english: With their minds fully in Me and their lives devoted to Me, they always enlighten one another and converse about Me. Thus they feel satisfaction and bliss.

verses.original:
तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् ।
ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते ॥ १० ॥
verses.transliteration:
teṣhāṁ satata-yuktānāṁ bhajatāṁ prīti-pūrvakam |
dadāmi buddhi-yogaṁ taṁ yena mām upayānti te || 10 ||

translations.english: To those who are constantly devoted and worship Me with love, I give the **yoga of understanding** (**buddhi-yoga**), by which they come to Me.

verses.original:
तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तमः ।
नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता ॥ ११ ॥
verses.transliteration:
teṣhām evānukampārtham aham ajñāna-jaṁ tamaḥ |
nāśhayāmy ātma-bhāva-stho jñāna-dīpena bhāsvatā || 11 ||

translations.english: Out of compassion for them, I, dwelling in their hearts, destroy the darkness born of ignorance with the shining **lamp of knowledge**.

verses.original:
अर्जुन उवाच
परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् ।
पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम् ॥ १२ ॥
verses.transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
paraṁ brahma paraṁ dhāma pavitraṁ paramaṁ bhavān |
puruṣhaṁ śhāśhvatam divyam ādi-devam ajaṁ vibhum || 12 ||

translations.english: Arjuna said: You are the **Supreme Brahman**, the supreme abode, the supreme purifier, the eternal, divine Person, the primeval God (Ādi-Devam), the unborn (Aja), and the all-pervading (Vibhu).

verses.original:
आहुस्त्वामृषयः सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा ।
असितो देवलो व्यासः स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे ॥ १३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
āhus tvām ṛṣhayaḥ sarve devarṣhir nāradas tathā |
asito devalo vyāsaḥ swayaṁ chaiva bravīṣhi me || 13 ||

translations.english: All the sages, including the divine sage **Nārada**, as well as **Asita**, **Devala**, and **Vyāsa**, confirm this about You, and now You Yourself are telling me.

verses.original:
सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव ।
न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवाः ॥ १४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
sarvam etad ṛtaṁ manye yan māṁ vadasi keśhava |
na hi te bhagavan vyaktiṁ vidur devā na dānavāḥ || 14 ||

translations.english: O Keśhava (Krishna), I totally accept as truth everything You have told me. Neither the celestial gods nor the demons, O Lord, understand Your manifestation.

verses.original:
स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम ।
भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते ॥ १५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
svayam evātmanātmānaṁ vettha tvaṁ puruṣhottama |
bhūta-bhāvana bhūteśha deva-deva jagat-pate || 15 ||

translations.english: Indeed, You alone know Yourself by Your internal power, O Supreme Person (Puruṣhottama), O creator of beings (Bhūta-bhāvana), O Lord of all beings (Bhūteśha), O God of gods (Deva-deva), O Lord of the universe (Jagat-pate).

verses.original:
वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः ।
याभिर्विभूतिभीर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि ॥ १६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
vaktum arhasi aśheṣheṇa divyā hy ātma-vibhūtayaḥ |
yābhir vibhūtibhir lokān imāṁs tvaṁ vyāpya tiṣhṭhasi || 16 ||

translations.english: Please tell me in detail of Your **divine glories** (**ātma-vibhūtayaḥ**) by which You pervade and remain in all these worlds.

verses.original:
कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन् ।
केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया ॥ १७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
kathaṁ vidyām ahaṁ yogins tvāṁ sadā parichintayan |
keṣhu keṣhu cha bhāveṣhu chintyo 'si bhagavan mayā || 17 ||

translations.english: O Yogi, how shall I constantly meditate and know You? And in what various forms (bhāveṣhu), O Lord, are You to be contemplated by me?

verses.original:
विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन ।
भूयः कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम् ॥ १८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
vistareṇātmano yogaṁ vibhūtiṁ cha janārdana |
bhūyaḥ kathaya tṛptir hi śṛṇvato nāsti me 'mṛtam || 18 ||

translations.english: O Janārdana (Krishna), please narrate again in detail Your power of Yoga and Your glories (**vibhūti**), for I am never satiated by hearing Your immortal words.

verses.original:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः ।
प्राधान्यतः कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे ॥ १९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
hanta te kathayiṣhyāmi divyā hy ātma-vibhūtayaḥ |
prādhānyataḥ kuru-śhreṣhṭha nāsty anto vistarasya me || 19 ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: Yes, I shall certainly describe to you My divine glories, O best of the Kurus, but only those that are prominent, for there is **no end to the details** of My opulence.

verses.original:
अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः ।
अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च ॥ २० ॥
verses.transliteration:
aham ātmā guḍākeśha sarva-bhūtāśhaya-sthitaḥ |
aham ādiśh cha madhyaṁ cha bhūtānām anta eva cha || 20 ||

translations.english: O Guḍākeśha (Arjuna), I am the **Self** (**Ātmā**) dwelling in the heart of all beings. I am the **beginning**, the **middle**, and also the **end** of all beings.

verses.original:
आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान् ।
मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी ॥ २ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
ādityānām ahaṁ viṣhṇur jyotiṣhāṁ ravir aṁśhumān |
marīchir marutām asmi nakṣhatrāṇām ahaṁ śhaśhī || 21 ||

translations.english: Among the Ādityas, I am **Viṣhṇu**; among lights, I am the radiant **sun**; among the Maruts (wind gods), I am **Marīchi**; and among the constellations, I am the **moon** (śaśhī).

verses.original:
वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासवः ।
इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना ॥ २ २ ॥
verses.transliteration:
vedānāṁ sāma-vedo 'smi devānām asmi vāsavaḥ |
indriyāṇāṁ manaśh chāsmi bhūtānām asmi chetanā || 22 ||

translations.english: Among the Vedas, I am the **Sāma Veda**; among the demigods, I am **Indra** (Vāsava); among the senses, I am the **mind**; and in living beings, I am **consciousness**.

verses.original:
रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम् ।
वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरुः शिखरिणामहम् ॥ २ ३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
rudrāṇāṁ śhaṅkaraśh chāsmi vitteśho yakṣha-rakṣhasām |
vasūnāṁ pāvakaśh chāsmi meruḥ śhikharinām aham || 23 ||

translations.english: Among the Rudras, I am **Śhaṅkara** (Shiva); among the Yakṣhas and Rākṣhasas (goblins and demons), I am the Lord of wealth (**Kuvera**); among the Vasus, I am **fire** (Pāvaka); and among mountains, I am **Meru**.

verses.original:
पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम् ।
सेनानीनामहं स्कन्दः सरसामस्मि सागरः ॥ २४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
purodhasāṁ cha mukhyaṁ māṁ viddhi pārtha bṛhaspatim |
senānīnām ahaṁ skandaḥ sarasām asmi sāgaraḥ || 24 ||

translations.english: O son of Pṛthā, know Me to be **Bṛhaspati**, the chief among the priests; among military generals, I am **Skanda** (Kārtikeya); and among bodies of water, I am the **ocean**.

verses.original:
महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम् ।
यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालयः ॥ २५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
maharṣhīṇāṁ bhṛgur ahaṁ girām asmy ekam akṣharam |
yajñānāṁ japa-yajño 'smi sthāvarāṇāṁ himālayaḥ || 25 ||

translations.english: Among the great sages (maharṣhis), I am **Bhṛgu**; among words, I am the **single syllable Om**; among sacrifices, I am the **Japa Yajña** (chanting of holy names); and among immovable things, I am the **Himālaya**.

verses.original:
अश्वत्थः सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारदः ।
गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथः सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनिः ॥ २ ६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
aśhvatthaḥ sarva-vṛkṣhāṇāṁ devarṣhīṇāṁ cha nāradaḥ |
gandharvāṇāṁ chitra-rathaḥ siddhānāṁ kapilo muniḥ || 26 ||

translations.english: Among all trees, I am the **banyan tree** (Aśhvattha); among the divine sages (devarṣhis), I am **Nārada**; among the Gandharvas, I am **Chitraratha**; and among the perfected beings (Siddhas), I am **Kapila Muni**.

verses.original:
उच्चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम् ।
ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम् ॥ २ ७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
uchchaiḥśhravasam aśhvānāṁ viddhi mām amṛtodbhavam |
airāvataṁ gajendrāṇāṁ narāṇāṁ cha narādhipam || 27 ||

translations.english: Know Me to be **Uchchaiḥśhravas**, born of the churning of the ocean, among horses; **Airāvata** among lordly elephants; and the **king** (narādhipam) among men.

verses.original:
आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक् ।
प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्पः सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकिः ॥ २ ८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
āyudhānām ahaṁ vajraṁ dhenūnām asmi kāma-dhuk |
prajanaśh chāsmi kandarpaḥ sarpāṇām asmi vāsukiḥ || 28 ||

translations.english: Among weapons, I am the **thunderbolt** (Vajra); among cows, I am the wish-fulfilling cow (**Kāmadhenu**); I am **Kandarpa** (Cupid), the cause of procreation; and among serpents, I am **Vāsuki**.

verses.original:
अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम् ।
पितॄणामर्यमा चास्मि यमः संयमतामहम् ॥ २ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
anantaśh chāsmi nāgānāṁ varuṇo yādasām aham |
pitṝṇām aryamā chāsmi yamaḥ saṁyamatām aham || 29 ||

translations.english: Among the Nāgas (multi-headed serpents), I am **Ananta** (Śhesha); among the aquatic beings, I am **Varuṇa** (god of the ocean); among the ancestors (pitṛs), I am **Aryamā**; and among the restrainers, I am **Yama** (the controller of death).

verses.original:
प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां कालः कलयतामहम् ।
मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम् ॥ ३० ॥
verses.transliteration:
prahlādaśh chāsmi daityānāṁ kālaḥ kalayatām aham |
mṛgāṇāṁ cha mṛgendro 'haṁ vainateyaśh cha pakṣhiṇām || 30 ||

translations.english: Among the demons (Daityas), I am **Prahlāda**; among calculaters, I am **Time** (Kāla); among animals, I am the **lion**; and among birds, I am **Garuḍa** (Vainateya).

verses.original:
पवनः पवतामस्मि रामः शस्त्रभृतामहम् ।
झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी ॥ ३ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
pavanaḥ pavatām asmi rāmaḥ śhastra-bhṛtām aham |
jhaṣhāṇāṁ makaraśh chāsmi srotasām asmi jāhnavī || 31 ||

translations.english: Among purifiers, I am the **wind** (Pavana); among wielders of weapons, I am **Rāma**; among fish, I am the **shark** (makara); and among flowing rivers, I am the **Ganges** (Jāhnavī).

verses.original:
सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन ।
अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वादः प्रवदतामहम् ॥ ३ २ ॥
verses.transliteration:
sargāṇām ādir antaśh cha madhyaṁ chaivāham arjuna |
adhyātma-vidyā vidyānāṁ vādaḥ pravadatām aham || 32 ||

translations.english: Of all creations, I am the **beginning, the end, and also the middle**, O Arjuna. Among sciences, I am **spiritual knowledge** (**adhyātma-vidyā**); and among arguments, I am the decisive truth (**vāda**).

verses.original:
अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्वः सामासिकस्य च ।
अहमेवाक्षयः कालो धाताहं विश्वतोमुखः ॥ ३ ३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
akṣharāṇām akāro 'smi dvandvaḥ sāmāsikasya cha |
aham evākṣhayaḥ kālo dhātāhaṁ viśhvato-mukhaḥ || 33 ||

translations.english: Among letters, I am the letter **'A'** (**akāra**); among compound words, I am the **dual compound** (dvandva); I am also the inexhaustible **Time** (akṣhayaḥ kālo); and I am the creator whose face is everywhere (**Viśhvato-mukhaḥ**).

verses.original:
मृत्युः सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भवश्च भविष्यताम् ।
कीर्तिः श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृतिः क्षमा ॥ ३ ४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
mṛtyuḥ sarva-haraśh chāham udbhavaśh cha bhaviṣhyatām |
kīrtiḥ śhrīr vāk cha nārīṇāṁ smṛtir medhā dhṛtiḥ kṣhamā || 34 ||

translations.english: I am the all-devouring **death**, and I am the **origin** of all beings yet to be. Among feminine qualities, I am **fame, fortune, speech, memory, intelligence, steadfastness, and forgiveness**.

verses.original:
बृहत्साम तथा साम्नां गायत्री छन्दसामहम् ।
मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकरः ॥ ३ ५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
bṛhat-sāma tathā sāmnāṁ gāyatrī chhandasām aham |
māsānāṁ mārga-śhīrṣho 'ham ṛtūnāṁ kusumākaraḥ || 35 ||

translations.english: Among the hymns in the Sāma Veda, I am the **Bṛhat-Sāma**; among poetic meters, I am the **Gāyatrī**; among months, I am **Mārgaśhīrṣha** (November-December); and among seasons, I am the **spring** (Kusumākara).

verses.original:
द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् ।
जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम् ॥ ३ ६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
dyūtaṁ chhalayatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham |
jayo 'smi vyavasāyo 'smi sattvaṁ sattva-vatām aham || 36 ||

translations.english: Among acts of deception, I am **gambling**; I am the **splendor** of the splendid; I am **victory**; I am **determination**; and I am the **goodness** (sattva) of the good.

verses.original:
वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनञ्जयः ।
मुनीनामप्यहं व्यासः कवीनामुशना कविः ॥ ३ ७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
vṛṣhṇīnāṁ vāsudevo 'smi pāṇḍavānāṁ dhanañjayaḥ |
munīnām apy ahaṁ vyāsaḥ kavīnām uśhanā kaviḥ || 37 ||

translations.english: Among the Vṛṣhṇis, I am **Vāsudeva** (Krishna); among the Pāṇḍavas, I am **Arjuna** (Dhanañjaya); among the sages, I am **Vyāsa**; and among the thoughtful poets, I am **Uśhanā** (Śhukrāchārya).

verses.original:
दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम् ।
मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम् ॥ ३ ८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
daṇḍo damayatām asmi nītir asmi jigīṣhatām |
maunaṁ chāivāsmi guhyānāṁ jñānaṁ jñānavatām aham || 38 ||

translations.english: I am the **rod of punishment** among those who subdue; I am **morality** (nīti) among those who seek victory; I am **silence** among secrets; and I am the **knowledge** of the knowledgeable.

verses.original:
यच्चापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन ।
न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम् ॥ ३ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yach chāpi sarva-bhūtānāṁ bījaṁ tad aham arjuna |
na tad asti vinā yat syān mayā bhūtaṁ charācharam || 39 ||

translations.english: O Arjuna, whatever is the **seed** of all beings, that **I am**. There is no moving or non-moving being that can exist without Me.

verses.original:
नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतीनां परन्तप ।
एष तूद्देशतः प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया ॥ ४० ॥
verses.transliteration:
nānto 'sti mama divyānāṁ vibhūtīnāṁ parantapa |
eṣha tūddeśhataḥ prokto vibhūter vistaro mayā || 40 ||

translations.english: O vanquisher of foes, there is **no end to My divine glories** (**vibhūtīnām**). Whatever I have described to you is only a tiny fraction of My opulence.

verses.original:
यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा ।
तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोंऽशसम्भवम् ॥ ४ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yad yad vibhūtimat sattvaṁ śhrīmad ūrjitam eva vā |
tat tad evāvagachchha tvaṁ mama tejo-'ṁśha-sambhavam || 41 ||

translations.english: **Whatever being is glorious, beautiful, and mighty**—know that all such creations have sprung from a mere **spark of My splendor**.

verses.original:
अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन ।
विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत् ॥ ४ २ ॥
verses.transliteration:
athavā bahunaitena kiṁ jñātena tavārjuna |
viṣhṭabhyāham idaṁ kṛtsnam ekāṁśhena sthito jagat || 42 ||

translations.english: But what need is there, O Arjuna, for all this detailed knowledge? I sustain this entire universe, pervading it **with a single fragment of Myself** (**ekāṁśhena**).

chapters.name: Viśvarūpa Darśhana Yoga: The Yoga of the Vision of the Universal Form
chapters.summary: At Arjuna's request, Krishna reveals His boundless, all-encompassing Cosmic Form (Viśvarūpa). Overwhelmed by this terrifying yet magnificent vision, Arjuna begs Krishna to return to His beautiful human form.

verses.original:
अर्जुन उवाच
मदनुग्रहाय परमं गुह्यमध्यात्मसञ्ज्ञितम् ।
यत्त्वयोक्तं वचस्तेन मोहोऽयं विगतो मम ॥ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
mad-anugrahāya paramaṁ guhyam adhyātma-sañjñitam |
yat tvayoktaṁ vachas tena moho 'yaṁ vigato mama || 1 ||

translations.english: Arjuna said: Out of compassion for me, You have spoken these supreme, most confidential words concerning the spiritual Self (adhyātma). By those words, my delusion is now dispelled.

verses.original:
भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया ।
त्वत्तः कमलपत्राक्ष माहात्म्यमपि चाव्ययम् ॥ २ ॥
verses.transliteration:
bhavāpyayau hi bhūtānāṁ śhrutau vistaraśho mayā |
tvattaḥ kamala-patrākṣha māhātmyam api chāvyayam || 2 ||

translations.english: O lotus-eyed one, I have heard from You in detail about the creation and dissolution of beings, and also Your inexhaustible glories.

verses.original:
एवमेतद्यथात्थ त्वमात्मानं परमेश्वर ।
द्रष्टुमिच्छामि ते रूपमैश्वरं पुरुषोत्तम ॥ ३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
evam etad yathāttha tvam ātmānaṁ parameśhvara |
draṣhṭum ichchhāmi te rūpam aiśhvaraṁ puruṣhottama || 3 ||

translations.english: O Supreme Lord (Parameśhvara), although I accept that You are exactly as You have described Yourself, O Puruṣhottama (Supreme Person), I desire to see Your **divine form** (**aiśhvaraṁ rūpam**).

verses.original:
मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया द्रष्टुमिति प्रभो ।
योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानमव्ययम् ॥ ४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
manyase yadi tach chhakyaṁ mayā draṣhṭum iti prabho |
yogeśhvara tato me tvaṁ darśhayātmānam avyayam || 4 ||

translations.english: If You think it is possible for me to behold that form, O Lord, then, O Master of Yoga (**Yogeśhvara**), please show me Your immutable Self.

verses.original:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः ।
नानाविधानि दिव्यानि नानावर्णाकृतीनि च ॥ ५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
paśhya me pārtha rūpāṇi śhataśho 'tha sahasraśhaḥ |
nānā-vidhāni divyāni nānā-varṇākṛtīni cha || 5 ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: Behold, O son of Pṛthā, My hundreds and thousands of diverse, heavenly forms, of various colors and shapes.

verses.original:
पश्यादित्यान्वसून्रुद्रानश्विनौ मरुतस्तथा ।
बहून्यदृष्टपूर्वाणि पश्याश्चर्याणि भारत ॥ ६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
paśhyādityān vasūn rudrān aśhvinau marutas tathā |
bahūny adṛṣhṭa-pūrvāṇi paśhyāśhcharyāṇi bhārata || 6 ||

translations.english: Behold the Ādityas, the Vasus, the Rudras, the Aśhvinī-Kumāras, and the Maruts. See, O descendant of Bharata, many wonders never seen before.

verses.original:
इहैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य सचराचरम् ।
मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्चान्यद्द्रष्टुमिच्छसि ॥ ७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
ihaika-sthaṁ jagat kṛtsnaṁ paśhyādya sa-charācharam |
mama dehe guḍākeśha yach chānyad draṣhṭum ichchhasi || 7 ||

translations.english: Behold, O Guḍākeśha (Arjuna), the entire universe, moving and non-moving, **unified in one place, right here within My body**, and whatever else you wish to see.

verses.original:
न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा ।
दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् ॥ ८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
na tu māṁ śhakyase draṣhṭum anenaiva sva-chakṣhuṣhā |
divyaṁ dadāmi te chakṣhuḥ paśhya me yogam aiśhvaram || 8 ||

translations.english: But you cannot see Me with your present (ordinary) eyes. Therefore, **I give you divine vision**; behold My supreme and mystical opulence (**yogam aiśhvaram**).

verses.original:
सञ्जय उवाच
एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन् महायोगेश्वरो हरिः ।
दर्शयामास पार्थाय परमं रूपमैश्वरम् ॥ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
sañjaya uvācha
evam uktvā tato rājan mahā-yogeśhvaro hariḥ |
darśhayām āsa pārthāya paramaṁ rūpam aiśhvaram || 9 ||

translations.english: Sañjaya said: O King, having spoken thus, the Supreme Master of all mystic power, Hari (Krishna), then revealed to Pṛthā’s son (Arjuna) the supreme divine form.

verses.original:
अनेकवक्त्रनयनमनेकाद्भुतदर्शनम् ।
अनेकदिव्याभरणं दिव्यानेकोद्यतायुधम् ॥ १० ॥
verses.transliteration:
aneka-vaktra-nayanam anekādbhuta-darśhanam |
aneka-divyābharaṇaṁ divyānekodyatāyudham || 10 ||

translations.english: It was a form with countless mouths and eyes, displaying numerous wondrous sights, adorned with many celestial ornaments, and holding many divine weapons ready for use.

verses.original:
दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरं दिव्यगन्धानुलेपनम् ।
सर्वाश्चर्यमयं देवमनन्तं विश्वतोमुखम् ॥ ११ ॥
verses.transliteration:
divya-mālyāmbara-dharaṁ divya-gandhānulepanam |
sarvāśhcharya-mayaṁ devam anantaṁ viśhvato-mukham || 11 ||

translations.english: He wore divine garlands and garments, anointed with celestial perfumes. It was the all-wondrous, infinite God, whose face was turned in all directions (**viśhvato-mukham**).

verses.original:
दिवि सूर्यसहस्रस्य भवेद्युगपदुत्थिता ।
यदि भाः सदृशी सा स्याद्भासस्तस्य महात्मनः ॥ १२ ॥
verses.transliteration:
divi sūrya-sahasrasya bhaved yugapad utthitā |
yadi bhāḥ sadṛśhī sā syād bhāsas tasya mahātmanaḥ || 12 ||

translations.english: If the radiance of a thousand suns were to burst forth simultaneously in the sky, that light might resemble the splendor of that great Self.

verses.original:
तत्रैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं प्रविभक्तमनेकधा ।
अपश्यद्देवदेवस्य शरीरे पाण्डवस्तदा ॥ १३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
tatraika-sthaṁ jagat kṛtsnaṁ pravibhaktam anekadhā |
apaśhyad deva-devasya śharīre pāṇḍavas tadā || 13 ||

translations.english: There, in the body of the God of gods, Arjuna (the Pāṇḍava) then saw the whole universe, manifoldly divided, yet all situated in **one place**.

verses.original:
ततः स विस्मयाविष्टो हृष्टरोमा धनञ्जयः ।
प्रणम्य शिरसा देवं कृताञ्जलिरभाषत ॥ १४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
tataḥ sa vismayāviṣhṭo hṛṣhṭa-romā dhanañjayaḥ |
praṇamya śhirasā devaṁ kṛtāñjalir abhāṣhata || 14 ||

translations.english: Then, Arjuna (Dhanañjaya), overwhelmed with astonishment and with his hair standing on end, bowed his head to the Lord and spoke with folded hands.

verses.original:
अर्जुन उवाच
पश्यामि देवांस्तव देव देहे सर्वांस्तथा भूतविशेषसङ्घान् ।
ब्रह्माणमीशं कमलासनस्थमृषींश्च सर्वानुरगांश्च दिव्यान् ॥ १५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
paśhyāmi devāṁs tava deva dehe sarvāṁs tathā bhūta-viśheṣha-saṅghān |
brahmāṇam īśhaṁ kamalāsana-stham ṛṣhīṁśh cha sarvān uragāṁśh cha divyān || 15 ||

translations.english: Arjuna said: O Lord, I see within Your body all the gods and hosts of various beings. I see Brahmā, the Lord, seated on the lotus, all the sages, and the divine serpents.

verses.original:
अनेकबाहूदरवक्त्रनेत्रं पश्यामि त्वां सर्वतोऽनन्तरूपम् ।
नान्तं न मध्यं न पुनस्तवादिं पश्यामि विश्वेश्वर विश्वरूप ॥ १६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
aneka-bāhūdara-vaktra-netraṁ paśhyāmi tvāṁ sarvato 'nanta-rūpam |
nāntaṁ na madhyaṁ na punas tavādiṁ paśhyāmi viśhveśhvara viśhva-rūpa || 16 ||

translations.english: O Lord of the universe, O Universal Form (**Viśvarūpa**), I see You with infinite arms, bellies, mouths, and eyes, boundless in all directions. **I see no end, no middle, and no beginning to You**.

verses.original:
किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रिणं च तेजोराशिं सर्वतो दीप्तिमन्तम् ।
पश्यामि त्वां दुर्निरीक्ष्यं समन्ताद्दीप्तानलार्कद्युतिमप्रमेयम् ॥ १७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
kirīṭinaṁ gadinaṁ chakriṇaṁ cha tejo-rāśhiṁ sarvato dīptimantam |
paśhyāmi tvāṁ dur-nirīkṣhyaṁ samantād dīptānala-arka-dyutim aprameyam || 17 ||

translations.english: I see You crowned, holding the mace and the discus, a mass of radiance shining everywhere. You are difficult to gaze upon, with the blazing effulgence of fire and the sun, immeasurable.

verses.original:
त्वमक्षरं परमं वेदितव्यं त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् ।
त्वमव्ययः शाश्वतधर्मगोप्ता सनातनस्त्वं पुरुषो मतो मे ॥ १८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
tvam akṣharaṁ paramaṁ veditavyaṁ tvam asya viśhvasya paraṁ nidhānam |
tvam avyayaḥ śhāśhvata-dharma-goptā sanātanas tvaṁ puruṣho mato me || 18 ||

translations.english: **You are the Imperishable (Akṣharam)**, the supreme object of knowledge. You are the supreme support of this universe. You are the inexhaustible protector of the eternal dharma. **You are the everlasting, original Person**—this is my conviction.

verses.original:
अनादिमध्यान्तमनन्तवीर्यमनन्तबाहुं शशिसूर्यनेत्रम् ।
पश्यामि त्वां दीप्तहुताशवक्त्रं स्वतेजसा विश्वमिदं तपन्तम् ॥ १९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
anādi-madhyāntam ananta-vīryam ananta-bāhuṁ śhaśhi-sūrya-netram |
paśhyāmi tvāṁ dīpta-hutāśha-vaktraṁ sva-tejasā viśhvam idaṁ tapantam || 19 ||

translations.english: I see You without beginning, middle, or end, with infinite power and countless arms, with the sun and moon as Your eyes, and Your mouth as a blazing fire, heating this universe with Your own radiance.

verses.original:
द्यावापृथिव्योरिदमन्तरं हि व्याप्तं त्वयैकेन दिशश्च सर्वाः ।
दृष्ट्वाद्भुतं रूपमुग्रं तवेदं लोकत्रयं प्रव्यथितं महात्मन् ॥ २० ॥
verses.transliteration:
dyāvāpṛthivyor idam antaraṁ hi vyāptaṁ tvayaikena diśhaśh cha sarvāḥ |
dṛṣhṭvādbhutaṁ rūpam ugraṁ tavedaṁ loka-trayaṁ pravyathitaṁ mahātman || 20 ||

translations.english: The space between heaven and earth, and all the directions, are filled by You alone. Seeing this wondrous, terrible form of Yours, O great soul, the **three worlds are trembling with fear**.

verses.original:
अमी हि त्वा सुरसङ्घा विशन्ति केचिद् भीताः प्राञ्जलयो गृणन्ति ।
स्वस्तीत्युक्त्वा महर्षिसिद्धसङ्घाः स्तुवन्ति त्वां स्तुतिभिः पुष्कलाभिः ॥ २ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
amī hi tvā sura-saṅghā viśhanti kechid bhītāḥ prāñjalayo gṛṇanti |
svastīty uktvā maharṣhi-siddha-saṅghāḥ stuvanti tvāṁ stutibhiḥ puṣhkalābhiḥ || 21 ||

translations.english: Indeed, those hosts of demigods are entering You, while some, struck by fear, praise You with folded hands. The assemblies of great sages and Siddhas, crying 'All hail!', hymn Your praises with glorious stotras.

verses.original:
रुद्रादित्या वसवो ये च साध्या विश्वेऽश्विनौ मरुतश्चोष्मपाश्च ।
गन्धर्वयक्षासुरसिद्धसङ्घा वीक्षन्ते त्वां विस्मिताश्चैव सर्वे ॥ २ २ ॥
verses.transliteration:
rudrādityā vasavo ye cha sādhyā viśhve 'śhvinau marutaśh choṣhmapāśh cha |
gandharva-yakṣhāsura-siddha-saṅghā vīkṣhante tvāṁ vismitāśh chaiva sarve || 22 ||

translations.english: The Rudras, Ādityas, Vasus, Sādhyas, Viśhve Devās, Aśhvinī-Kumāras, Maruts, and the Pitṛs (ancestors), along with the Gandharvas, Yakṣhas, Asuras, and Siddhas—**all are gazing at You, completely astounded**.

verses.original:
रूपं महत्ते बहुवक्त्रनेत्रं महाबाहो बहुबाहूरुपादम् ।
बहूदरं बहुदंष्ट्राकरालं दृष्ट्वा लोकाः प्रव्यथितास्तथाहम् ॥ २ ३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
rūpaṁ mahat te bahu-vaktra-netraṁ mahā-bāho bahu-bāhūru-pādam |
bahūdaraṁ bahu-daṁṣhṭrā-karālaṁ dṛṣhṭvā lokāḥ pravyathitās tathāham || 23 ||

translations.english: Seeing Your mighty form, O mighty-armed one, with its many mouths and eyes, many arms, thighs, and feet, many bellies, and terrifying with many great fangs, the worlds are trembling with fear, and so am I.

verses.original:
नभःस्पृशं दीप्तमनेकवर्णं व्यात्ताननं दीप्तविशालनेत्रम् ।
दृष्ट्वा हि त्वां प्रव्यथितान्तरात्मा धृतिं न विन्दामि शमं च विष्णो ॥ २४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
nabhaḥ-spṛśhaṁ dīptam aneka-varṇaṁ vyāttānanaṁ dīpta-viśhāla-netram |
dṛṣhṭvā hi tvāṁ pravyathitāntarātmā dhṛtiṁ na vindāmi śhamaṁ cha viṣhṇo || 24 ||

translations.english: O Viṣhṇu, seeing You touching the sky, blazing with many colors, with widely open mouths and huge, glowing eyes, my inner self is trembling. I find neither courage nor peace.

verses.original:
दंष्ट्राकरालानि च ते मुखानि दृष्ट्वैव कालानलसन्निभानि ।
दिशो न जाने न लभे च शर्म प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास ॥ २५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
daṁṣhṭrā-karālāni cha te mukhāni dṛṣhṭvaiva kālānala-sannibhāni |
diśho na jāne na labhe cha śharma prasīda deveśha jagan-nivāsa || 25 ||

translations.english: Seeing Your faces, terrifying with fangs and resembling the fire of cosmic dissolution (Kālānala), I am bewildered and find no comfort. Be gracious, O Lord of gods, O refuge of the universe.

verses.original:
अमी च त्वां धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्राः सर्वे सहैवावनिपालसङ्घैः ।
भीष्मो द्रोणः सूतपुत्रस्तथासौ सहास्मदीयैरपि योधमुख्यैः ॥ २ ६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
amī cha tvāṁ dhṛtarāṣhṭrasya putrāḥ sarve sahaivāvani-pāla-saṅghaiḥ |
bhīṣhmo droṇaḥ sūta-putras tathāsau sahāsmadīyair api yodha-mukhyaiḥ || 26 ||

translations.english: All these sons of Dhṛtarāṣhṭra, along with the hosts of kings, Bhīṣhma, Droṇa, and that son of Sūta (Karṇa), accompanied by our own chief warriors,

verses.original:
वक्त्राणि ते त्वरमाणा विशन्ति दंष्ट्राकरालानि भयानकानि ।
केचिद्विलग्ना दशनान्तरेषु सन्दृश्यन्ते चूर्णितैरुत्तमाङ्गैः ॥ २ ७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
vaktrāṇi te tvaramāṇā viśhanti daṁṣhṭrā-karālāni bhayānakāni |
kechid vilagnā daśhanāntareṣhu sandṛśhyante chūrṇitair uttamāṅgaiḥ || 27 ||

translations.english: —are rushing headlong into Your mouths, which are terrifying with fangs and awful to behold. Some are seen trapped between Your teeth, with their heads crushed.

verses.original:
यथा नदीनां बहवोऽम्बुवेगाः समुद्रमेवाभिमुखा द्रवन्ति ।
तथा तवामी नरलोकवीरा विशन्ति वक्त्राण्यभिविज्वलन्ति ॥ २ ८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yathā nadīnāṁ bahavo 'mbu-vegāḥ samudram evābhimukhā dravanti |
tathā tavāmī nara-loka-vīrā viśhanti vaktrāṇy abhivijvalanti || 28 ||

translations.english: As the many swift currents of rivers flow headlong into the ocean, similarly, these heroes of the mortal world are rushing into Your blazing mouths.

verses.original:
यथा प्रदीप्तं ज्वलनं पतङ्गा विशन्ति नाशाय समृद्धवेगाः ।
तथैव नाशाय विशन्ति लोकास्तवापि वक्त्राणि समृद्धवेगाः ॥ २ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yathā pradīptaṁ jvalanaṁ pataṅgā viśhanti nāśhāya samṛddha-vegāḥ |
tathaiva nāśhāya viśhanti lokās tavāpi vaktrāṇi samṛddha-vegāḥ || 29 ||

translations.english: As moths rush with full speed into a blazing fire only to perish, so too are these beings rushing into Your mouths to their destruction, with increasing velocity.

verses.original:
लेलिह्यसे ग्रसमानः समन्ताल्लोकान्समग्रान्वदनैर्ज्वलद्भिः ।
तेजोभिरापूर्य जगत्समग्रं भासस्तवोग्राः प्रतपन्ति विष्णो ॥ ३० ॥
verses.transliteration:
lelihyase grasamānaḥ samantāl lokān samagrān vadanair jvaladbhiḥ |
tejobhir āpūrya jagat samagraṁ bhāsas tavogrāḥ pratapanti viṣhṇo || 30 ||

translations.english: You are licking up all the worlds, devouring them from all sides with Your blazing mouths. Your terrible splendors, O Viṣhṇu, are filling the entire universe with their heat and burning it.

verses.original:
आख्याहि मे को भवानुग्ररूपो नमोऽस्तु ते देववर प्रसीद ।
विज्ञातुमिच्छामि भवन्तमाद्यं न हि प्रजानामि तव प्रवृत्तिम् ॥ ३ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
ākhyāhi me ko bhavān ugra-rūpo namo 'stu te deva-vara prasīda |
vijñātum ichchhāmi bhavantam ādyaṁ na hi prajānāmi tava pravṛttim || 31 ||

translations.english: Tell me, **who are You** in this fierce form? Salutations to You, O Supreme God! Be gracious. I wish to know You, the primeval Being, for I do not understand Your operation (pravṛttim).

verses.original:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
कालोऽस्मि लोकक्षयकृत्प्रवृद्धो लोकान्समाहर्तुमिह प्रवृत्तः ।
ऋतेऽपि त्वां न भविष्यन्ति सर्वे येऽवस्थिताः प्रत्यनीकेषु योधाः ॥ ३ २ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
kālo 'smi loka-kṣhaya-kṛt pravṛddho lokān samāhartum iha pravṛttaḥ |
ṛte 'pi tvāṁ na bhaviṣhyanti sarve ye 'vasthitāḥ pratyanīkeṣhu yodhāḥ || 32 ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: **I am Time (Kāla)**, the mighty destroyer of worlds, and I have come forth to annihilate all people. Even without your participation, all the warriors standing in the opposing armies **shall cease to exist**.

verses.original:
तस्मात्त्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्व जित्वा शत्रून् भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यं समृद्धम् ।
मयैवैते निहताः पूर्वमेव निमित्तमात्रं भव सव्यसाचिन् ॥ ३ ३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
tasmāt tvam uttiṣhṭha yaśho labhasva jitvā śhatrūn bhuṅkṣhva rājyaṁ samṛddham |
mayāivaite nihatāḥ pūrvam eva nimitta-mātraṁ bhava savya-sāchin || 33 ||

translations.english: Therefore, arise! Achieve glory, conquer your enemies, and enjoy a prosperous kingdom. **By Me alone have they already been destroyed**; become merely the **instrument** (nimitta-mātraṁ), O expert archer (Savya-sāchin).

verses.original:
द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं च कर्णं तथान्यानपि योधवीरान् ।
मया हतांस्त्वं जहि मा व्यथिष्ठा युध्यस्व जेतासि रणे सपत्नान् ॥ ३ ४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
droṇaṁ cha bhīṣhmaṁ cha jayadrathaṁ cha karṇaṁ tathānyān api yodha-vīrān |
mayā hatāṁs tvaṁ jahi mā vyathiṣhṭhā yudhyasva jetāsi raṇe sapatnān || 34 ||

translations.english: Slay Droṇa, Bhīṣhma, Jayadratha, Karṇa, and other heroic warriors who are already killed by Me. Do not be distressed. **Fight! You will surely conquer your enemies in battle**.

verses.original:
सञ्जय उवाच
एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं केशवस्य कृताञ्जलिर्वेपमानः किरीटी ।
नमस्कृत्वा भूय एवाह कृष्णं सगद्गदं भीतभीतः प्रणम्य ॥ ३ ५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
sañjaya uvācha
etach chhrutvā vachanaṁ keśhavasya kṛtāñjalir vepamānaḥ kirīṭī |
namaskṛtvā bhūya evāha kṛṣhṇaṁ sa-gadgadaṁ bhīta-bhītaḥ praṇamya || 35 ||

translations.english: Sañjaya said: Having heard these words of Keśhava (Krishna), the crowned one (Arjuna), trembling and with folded hands, offered repeated obeisances, and spoke to Krishna in a faltering voice, overwhelmed with fear.

verses.original:
अर्जुन उवाच
स्थाने हृषीकेश तव प्रकीर्त्या जगत्प्रहृष्यत्यनुरज्यते च ।
रक्षान्सि भीतानि दिशो द्रवन्ति सर्वे नमस्यन्ति च सिद्धसङ्घाः ॥ ३ ६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
stāne hṛṣhīkeśha tava prakīrtyā jagat prahṛṣhyaty anurajyate cha |
rakṣhāṁsi bhītāni diśho dravanti sarve namasyanti cha siddha-saṅghāḥ || 36 ||

translations.english: Arjuna said: Rightly, O Hṛṣhīkeśha (Krishna), the world rejoices in singing Your praises and becomes devoted to You. The demons (rakṣhāṁsi), struck by fear, flee in all directions, and the hosts of Siddhas all bow to You.

verses.original:
कस्माच्च ते न नमेरन्महात्मन् गरीयसे ब्रह्मणोऽप्यादिकर्त्रे ।
अनन्त देवेश जगन्निवास त्वमक्षरं सदसत्तत्परं यत् ॥ ३ ७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
kasmāch cha te na nameran mahātman garīyase brahmaṇo 'py ādi-kartre |
ananta deveśha jagan-nivāsa tvam akṣharaṁ sad-asat tat paraṁ yat || 37 ||

translations.english: And why should they not bow down to You, O great soul (Mahātman)? You are the original creator, greater even than Brahmā. O infinite one, O Lord of the gods, O abode of the universe! **You are the Imperishable, the existence (sat) and non-existence (asat), and that which is beyond both**.

verses.original:
त्वमादिदेवः पुरुषः पुराणस्त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् ।
वेत्तासि वेद्यं च परं च धाम त्वया ततं विश्वमनन्तरूप ॥ ३ ८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
tvam ādi-devaḥ puruṣhaḥ purāṇas tvam asya viśhvasya paraṁ nidhānam |
vettāsi vedyaṁ cha paraṁ cha dhāma tvayā tataṁ viśhvam ananta-rūpa || 38 ||

translations.english: You are the **original God** (Ādi-deva), the ancient Person (Puruṣha Purāṇa). You are the supreme resting place of this universe. You are the knower, the object of knowledge, and the supreme abode. O boundless form, the universe is pervaded by You.

verses.original:
वायुर्यमोऽग्निर्वरुणः शशाङ्कः प्रजापतिस्त्वं प्रपितामहश्च ।
नमो नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्रकृत्वः पुनश्च भूयोऽपि नमो नमस्ते ॥ ३ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
vāyur yamo 'gnir varuṇaḥ śhaśāṅkaḥ prajāpatis tvaṁ prapitāmahaśh cha |
namo namas te 'stu sahasra-kṛtvaḥ punaśh cha bhūyo 'pi namo namas te || 39 ||

translations.english: You are Vāyu (wind), Yama (death), Agni (fire), Varuṇa (water), Śhaśāṅka (moon), Prajāpati (progenitor), and the great-grandfather. **Salutations, salutations to You a thousand times**, and again and again, salutations, salutations to You!

verses.original:
नमः पुरस्तादथ पृष्ठतस्ते नमोऽस्तु ते सर्वत एव सर्व ।
अनन्तवीर्यामितविक्रमस्त्वं सर्वं समाप्नोषि ततोऽसि सर्वः ॥ ४० ॥
verses.transliteration:
namaḥ purastād atha pṛṣhṭhatas te namo 'stu te sarvata eva sarva |
ananta-vīryāmita-vikramas tvaṁ sarvaṁ samāpnoṣhi tato 'si sarvaḥ || 40 ||

translations.english: Salutations to You from the front, and from behind! Salutations to You from all sides, O All! Your power is infinite, Your valor is boundless. You pervade all, and thus **You are everything**.

verses.original:
सखेति मत्वा प्रसभं यदुक्तं हे कृष्ण हे यादव हे सखेति ।
अजानता महिमानं तवेदं मया प्रमादात्प्रणयेन वापि ॥ ४ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
sakheti matvā prasabhaṁ yad uktaṁ he kṛṣhṇa he yādava he sakheti |
ajānatā mahimānaṁ tavedaṁ mayā pramādāt praṇayena vāpi || 41 ||

translations.english: Mistaking You for a friend, whatever I have rashly said, such as 'Hey Krishna,' 'Hey Yādava,' 'Hey friend,' out of negligence or out of affection, **not knowing Your greatness**—

verses.original:
यच्चावहासार्थमसत्कृतोऽसि विहारशय्यासनभोजनेषु ।
एकोऽथवाप्यच्युत तत्समक्षं तत्क्षामये त्वामहमप्रमेयम् ॥ ४ २ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yach chāvahāsārtham asat-kṛto 'si vihāra-śhayyāsana-bhojaneṣhu |
eko 'thavāpy achyuta tat-samakṣhaṁ tat kṣhāmaye tvām aham aprameyam || 42 ||

translations.english: —and whatever disrespect was shown to You, O infallible one, in jest, while relaxing, lying on a bed, sitting, or eating, either alone or in the presence of others: **I beg forgiveness from You, the immeasurable one**.

verses.original:
पितासि लोकस्य चराचरस्य त्वमस्य पूज्यश्च गुरुर्गरीयान् ।
न त्वत्समोऽस्त्यभ्यधिकः कुतोऽन्यो लोकत्रयेऽप्यप्रतिमप्रभाव ॥ ४ ३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
pitāsi lokasya charācharasya tvam asya pūjyaśh cha gurur garīyān |
na tvat-samo 'sty abhyadhikaḥ kuto 'nyo loka-traye 'py apratima-prabhāva || 43 ||

translations.english: You are the Father of the movable and immovable world, the worshipful Teacher, and the more venerable Guru. There is none equal to You, how then can there be anyone greater, in the three worlds, O You of incomparable power?

verses.original:
तस्मात्प्रणम्य प्रणिधाय कायं प्रसादये त्वामहमीशमीड्यम् ।
पितेव पुत्रस्य सखेव सख्युः प्रियः प्रियायार्हसि देव सोढुम् ॥ ४ ४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
tasmāt praṇamya praṇidhāya kāyaṁ prasādaye tvām aham īśham īḍyam |
piteva putrasya sakheva sakhyuḥ priyaḥ priyāyārhasi deva soḍhum || 44 ||

translations.english: Therefore, bowing down and prostrating my body, I beg Your grace, O adorable Lord. You should forgive my offenses, O God, just as a father forgives his son, a friend his friend, or a lover his beloved.

verses.original:
अदृष्टपूर्वं हृषितोऽस्मि दृष्ट्वा भयेन च प्रव्यथितं मनो मे ।
तदेव मे दर्शय देवरूपं प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास ॥ ४ ५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
adṛṣhṭa-pūrvaṁ hṛṣhito 'smi dṛṣhṭvā bhayena cha pravyathitaṁ mano me |
tad eva me darśhaya deva rūpaṁ prasīda deveśha jagan-nivāsa || 45 ||

translations.english: Seeing what was never seen before, I am delighted, yet my mind is tormented with fear. Therefore, O Lord of gods, O refuge of the universe, be gracious and show me that **(four-armed) form**.

verses.original:
किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्तमिच्छामि त्वां द्रष्टुमहं तथैव ।
तेनैव रूपेण चतुर्भुजेन सहस्रबाहो भव विश्वमूर्ते ॥ ४ ६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
kirīṭinaṁ gadinaṁ chakra-hastam ichchhāmi tvāṁ draṣhṭum ahaṁ tathaiva |
tenaiva rūpeṇa chatur-bhujena sahasra-bāho bhava viśhva-mūrte || 46 ||

translations.english: I wish to see You just as before, crowned, holding the mace, and with the discus in hand. O thousand-armed one, O Universal Form, please appear in that same **four-armed form**.

verses.original:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
मया प्रसन्नेन तवार्जुनेदं रूपं परं दर्शितमात्मयोगात् ।
तेजोमयं विश्वमनन्तमाद्यं यन्मे त्वदन्येन न दृष्टपूर्वम् ॥ ४ ७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
mayā prasannena tavārjunedaṁ rūpaṁ paraṁ darśhitam ātma-yogāt |
tejo-mayaṁ viśhvam anantam ādyaṁ yan me tvad anyena na dṛṣhṭa-pūrvam || 47 ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: O Arjuna, being pleased with you, I have shown you—by My own internal power (**ātma-yogāt**)—this supreme, universal, unlimited, resplendent, and primeval form, which has **never before been seen by anyone other than you**.

verses.original:
न वेदयज्ञाध्ययनैर्न दानैर्न च क्रियाभिर्न तपोभिरुग्रैः ।
एवंरूपः शक्यो नृलोके द्रष्टुं त्वदन्येन कुरुप्रवीर ॥ ४ ८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
na veda-yajñādhyayanair na dānair na cha kriyābhir na tapobhir ugraiḥ |
evaṁ-rūpaḥ śhakyo nṛ-loke draṣhṭuṁ tvad anyena kuru-pravīra || 48 ||

translations.english: Neither by the study of the Vedas, nor by sacrifices, nor by charity, nor by pious activities, nor by severe austerities, can this form be seen in the mortal world by anyone other than you, O best of the Kuru warriors.

verses.original:
मा ते व्यथा मा च विमूढभावो दृष्ट्वा रूपं घोरमीदृङ्ममेदम् ।
व्यपेतभीः प्रीतमनाः पुनस्त्वं तदेव मे रूपमिदं प्रपश्य ॥ ४ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
mā te vyathā mā cha vimūḍha-bhāvo dṛṣhṭvā rūpaṁ ghoram īdṛṅa mamedaṁ |
vyapeta-bhīḥ prīta-manāḥ punas tvaṁ tad eva me rūpam idaṁ prapaśhya || 49 ||

translations.english: Be freed from all fear and confusion upon seeing this terrifying form of Mine. With a fearless and cheerful mind, now behold My **original form** again.

verses.original:
सञ्जय उवाच
इत्यर्जुनं वासुदेवस्तथोक्त्वा स्वकं रूपं दर्शयामास भूयः ।
आश्वासयामास च भीतमेनं भूत्वा पुनः सौम्यवपुर्महात्मा ॥ ५० ॥
verses.transliteration:
sañjaya uvācha
ity arjunaṁ vāsudevas tathoktvā svakaṁ rūpaṁ darśhayām āsa bhūyaḥ |
āśhvāsayām āsa cha bhītam enaṁ bhūtvā punaḥ saumya-vapur mahātmā || 50 ||

translations.english: Sañjaya said: Having thus spoken to Arjuna, Vāsudeva (Krishna) once again displayed His own form. The Mahātman, assuming His gentle form, then reassured the frightened Arjuna.

verses.original:
अर्जुन उवाच
दृष्ट्वेदं मानुषं रूपं तव सौम्यं जनार्दन ।
इदानीमस्मि संवृत्तः सचेताः प्रकृतिं गतः ॥ ५ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
dṛṣhṭvedaṁ mānuṣhaṁ rūpaṁ tava saumyaṁ janārdana |
idānīm asmi saṁvṛttaḥ sa-chetāḥ prakṛtiṁ gataḥ || 51 ||

translations.english: Arjuna said: O Janārdana (Krishna), seeing this gentle, human form of Yours, I have now become composed and have returned to my natural state (of mind).

verses.original:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
सुदुर्दर्शमिदं रूपं दृष्टवानसि यन्मम ।
देवा अप्यस्य रूपस्य नित्यं दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः ॥ ५ २ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
su-durdarśham idaṁ rūpaṁ dṛṣhṭavān asi yan mama |
devā apy asya rūpasya nityaṁ darśhana-kāṅkṣhiṇaḥ || 52 ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: This form of Mine which you have seen is **extremely difficult to behold**. Even the demigods are perpetually desiring to see this form.

verses.original:
नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानेन न चेज्यया ।
शक्य एवंविधो द्रष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा ॥ ५ ३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
nāhaṁ vedair na tapasā na dānena na chejyayā |
śhakya evaṁ-vidho draṣhṭuṁ dṛṣhṭavān asi māṁ yathā || 53 ||

translations.english: The form of Mine which you have seen cannot be seen merely by studying the Vedas, nor by austerity, nor by charity, nor by worship.

verses.original:
भक्त्या त्वनन्यया शक्य अहमेवंविधोऽर्जुन ।
ज्ञातुं द्रष्टुं च तत्त्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परन्तप ॥ ५ ४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
bhaktyā tv ananyayā śhakya aham evaṁ-vidho 'rjuna |
jñātuṁ draṣhṭuṁ cha tattvena praveṣhṭuṁ cha parantapa || 54 ||

translations.english: But by **unalloyed devotion (bhaktyā tv ananyayā)**, O Arjuna, it is possible to know Me as I am, to see Me, and to enter into Me (attain My eternal abode), O conqueror of the foe.

verses.original:
मत्कर्मकृन्मत्परमो मद्भक्तः सङ्गवर्जितः ।
निर्वैरः सर्वभूतेषु यः स मामेति पाण्डव ॥ ५ ५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
mat-karma-kṛn mat-paramo mad-bhaktaḥ saṅga-varjitaḥ |
nirvairaḥ sarva-bhūteṣhu yaḥ sa mām eti pāṇḍava || 55 ||

translations.english: The one who **works for Me**, who has **Me as the supreme goal**, who is **devoted to Me**, who is **free from attachment**, and who is **without enmity toward any creature**—that person attains Me, O son of Pāṇḍu.

chapters.name: Bhakti Yoga
chapters.summary: The Yoga of Devotion. Arjuna asks which path is superior: worship of the personal form of the Lord (Saguṇa) or the formless, unmanifest Absolute (Nirguṇa). Krishna declares that devotees of His personal form are the most perfect Yogis. He then outlines the step-by-step process of practice (Abhyāsa) for those who cannot immediately fix their minds on Him and concludes by describing the twenty-two supreme qualities of the true devotee who is exceedingly dear to Him.

verses.original: अर्जुन उवाच | एवं सततयुक्ता ये भक्तास्त्वां पर्युपासते | ये चाप्यक्षरमव्यक्तं तेषां के योगवित्तमाः ||
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca | evaṁ satatayuktā ye bhaktās tvāṁ paryupāsate | ye cāpy akṣaram avyaktaṁ teṣāṁ ke yogavittamāḥ ||

translations.english: Arjuna asked: Those devotees who, ever-steadfast, worship You (the personal God), and those who worship the imperishable, unmanifest (Brahman)—of these two, who are the more perfect in Yoga?

verses.original: श्रीभगवानुवाच | मय्यावेश्य मनो ये मां नित्ययुक्ता उपासते | श्रद्धया परयोपेतास्ते मे युक्ततमा मताः ||
verses.transliteration: śrībhagavān uvāca | mayy āveśya mano ye māṁ nitya-yuktā upāsate | śraddhayā parayopetās te me yuktatamā matāḥ ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: Those who fix their minds upon Me and worship Me with constant, supreme faith, always engaged in My service—them I consider to be the most perfect in Yoga.

verses.original: ये त्वक्षरमनिर्देश्यमव्यक्तं पर्युपासते | सर्वत्रगमचिन्त्यं च कूटस्थमचलं ध्रुवम् ||
verses.transliteration: ye tv akṣaram anirdeśyam avyaktaṁ paryupāsate | sarvatragaṁ acintyaṁ ca kūṭastham acalaṁ dhruvam ||

translations.english: But those who fully worship the unmanifested, which is indefinable, all-pervading, inconceivable, unchanging, fixed, and eternal (the impersonal Brahman)...

verses.original: संनियम्येन्द्रियग्रामं सर्वत्र समबुद्धयः | ते प्राप्नुवन्ति मामेव सर्वभूतहिते रताः ||
verses.transliteration: saṁniyamye-ndriya-grāmaṁ sarvatra sama-buddhayaḥ | te prāpnuvanti mām eva sarva-bhūta-hite ratāḥ ||

translations.english: ...having restrained all their senses, being even-minded everywhere, and engaged in the welfare of all beings—they also attain Me.

verses.original: क्लेशोऽधिकतरस्तेषामव्यक्तासक्तचेतसाम् | अव्यक्ता हि गतिर्दुःखं देहवद्भिरवाप्यते ||
verses.transliteration: kleśo 'dhikataras teṣām avyaktāsakta-cetasām | avyaktā hi gatir duḥkhaṁ dehavadbhir avāpyate ||

translations.english: The struggle of those whose minds are attached to the unmanifest is greater. For embodied beings, the path of the unmanifest is difficult to traverse.

verses.original: ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्पराः | अनन्येनैव योगेन मां ध्यायन्त उपासते ||
verses.transliteration: ye tu sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi saṁnyasya matparāḥ | ananyenaiva yogena māṁ dhyāyanta upāsate ||

translations.english: But those who dedicate all their actions to Me, regarding Me as the supreme goal, and worship Me, meditating on Me with exclusive devotion...

verses.original: तेषामहं समुद्धर्ता मृत्युसंसारसागरात् | भवामि नचिरात्पार्थ मय्यावेशितचेतसाम् ||
verses.transliteration: teṣām ahaṁ samuddhartā mṛtyu-saṁsāra-sāgarāt | bhavāmi nacirāt pārtha mayy āveśita-cetasām ||

translations.english: O son of Pṛthā (Arjuna), for those whose minds are fixed on Me, I swiftly become their deliverer from the ocean of death and material existence.

verses.original: मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय | निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशयः ||
verses.transliteration: mayy eva mana ādhatsva mayi buddhiṁ niveśaya | nivasiṣyasi mayy eva ata ūrdhvaṁ na saṁśayaḥ ||

translations.english: Fix your mind on Me alone, and surrender your intellect to Me. Thereafter, you will live in Me alone, of this there is no doubt.

verses.original: अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शक्नोषि मयि स्थिरम् | अभ्यासयोगेन ततो मामिच्छाप्तुं धनञ्जय ||
verses.transliteration: atha cittaṁ samādhātuṁ na śaknoṣi mayi sthiram | abhyāsa-yogena tato mām icchāptuṁ dhanañjaya ||

translations.english: If, however, you are unable to fix your mind steadily on Me, O winner of wealth (Arjuna), then seek to attain Me through the Yoga of constant practice (Abhyāsa Yoga).

verses.original: अभ्यासेऽप्यसमर्थोऽसि मत्कर्मपरमो भव | मदर्थमपि कर्माणि कुर्वन् सिद्धिमवाप्स्यसि ||
verses.transliteration: abhyāse 'py asamartho 'si mat-karma-paramo bhava | mad-artham api karmāṇi kurvan siddhim avāpsyasi ||

translations.english: If you are unable to practice Abhyāsa Yoga, then be dedicated to working for Me. By performing actions for My sake, you will attain perfection.

verses.original: अथैतदप्यशक्तोऽसि कर्तुं मद्योगमाश्रितः | सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं ततः कुरु यतात्मवान् ||
verses.transliteration: athaitad apy aśakto 'si kartuṁ mad-yogam āśritaḥ | sarva-karma-phala-tyāgaṁ tataḥ kuru yatātmavān ||

translations.english: If you are unable even to do this, then, taking refuge in My Yoga, strive to renounce the fruit of all actions, being self-controlled.

verses.original: श्रेयो हि ज्ञानमभ्यासाज् ज्ञानाद् ध्यानं विशिष्यते | ध्यानात् कर्मफलत्यागस् त्यागाच्छान्तिरनन्तरम् ||
verses.transliteration: śreyo hi jñānam abhyāsāj jñānād dhyānaṁ viśiṣyate | dhyānāt karma-phala-tyāgas tyāgāc chāntir anantaram ||

translations.english: Knowledge (Jñāna) is better than mechanical practice (Abhyāsa); meditation (Dhyāna) is superior to knowledge; and renunciation of the fruit of action (Karma-phala-tyāga) is superior to meditation, for peace immediately follows such renunciation.

verses.original: अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च | निर्ममो निरहङ्कारः समदुःखसुखः क्षमी ||
verses.transliteration: adveṣṭā sarva-bhūtānāṁ maitraḥ karuṇa eva ca | nirmamo nirahaṅkāraḥ sama-duḥkha-sukhaḥ kṣamī ||

translations.english: That devotee of Mine who is without malice towards any being, who is friendly and compassionate, free from 'I' and 'mine' (possessiveness), equal in sorrow and joy, and forgiving...

verses.original: सन्तुष्टः सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चयः | मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः ||
verses.transliteration: santuṣṭaḥ satataṁ yogī yatātmā dṛḍha-niścayaḥ | mayy arpita-mano-buddhir yo mad-bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ ||

translations.english: ...ever-content, always a Yogi, having subdued the mind, with firm conviction, and whose mind and intellect are dedicated to Me—that devotee is dear to Me.

verses.original: यस्मान्नोद्विजते लोको लोकान्नोद्विजते च यः | हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो यः स च मे प्रियः ||
verses.transliteration: yasmān nodvijate loko lokān nodvijate ca yaḥ | harṣāmarṣa-bhayodvegair mukto yaḥ sa ca me priyaḥ ||

translations.english: That one from whom the world is not agitated, and who is not agitated by the world, who is free from elation, envy, fear, and anxiety—that person is also dear to Me.

verses.original: अनपेक्षः शुचिर्दक्ष उदासीनो गतव्यथः | सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः ||
verses.transliteration: anapekṣaḥ śucir dakṣa udāsīno gata-vyathaḥ | sarvārambha-parityāgī yo mad-bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ ||

translations.english: That devotee who is independent of desires, pure, expert, neutral (unconcerned), and free from all distress, and who has renounced all undertakings (for fruits of action)—that person is dear to Me.

verses.original: यो न हृष्यति न द्वेष्टि न शोचति न काङ्क्षति | शुभाशुभपरित्यागी भक्तिमान्यः स मे प्रियः ||
verses.transliteration: yo na hṛṣyati na dveṣṭi na śocati na kāṅkṣati | śubhāśubha-parityāgī bhaktimān yaḥ sa me priyaḥ ||

translations.english: That devotee who neither rejoices nor hates, neither grieves nor desires, who has relinquished both auspicious and inauspicious things, and is full of devotion—that person is dear to Me.

verses.original: समः शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानापमानयोः | शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु समः सङ्गविवर्जितः ||
verses.transliteration: samaḥ śatrau ca mitre ca tathā mānāpamānayoḥ | śītoṣṇa-sukha-duḥkheṣu samaḥ saṅga-vivarjitaḥ ||

translations.english: He who is equal to friend and foe, and equally so to honor and dishonor, who is alike in cold, heat, pleasure, and pain, and who is free from attachment...

verses.original: तुल्यनिन्दास्तुतिर्मौनी सन्तुष्टो येन केनचित् | अनिकेतः स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नरः ||
verses.transliteration: tulya-nindā-stutir maunī santuṣṭo yena kenacit | aniketaḥ sthira-matir bhaktimān me priyo naraḥ ||

translations.english: ...to whom censure and praise are equal, who is silent (contemplative), content with anything, who has no fixed abode (unattached to home), and whose mind is steady—that man, full of devotion, is dear to Me.

verses.original: ये तु धर्म्यामृतमिदं यथोक्तं पर्युपासते | श्रद्दधाना मत्परमा भक्तास्तेऽतीव मे प्रियाः ||
verses.transliteration: ye tu dharmyāmṛtam idaṁ yathoktaṁ paryupāsate | śraddadhānā mat-paramā bhaktās te 'tīva me priyāḥ ||

translations.english: But those who reverently follow this immortal path of Dharma (righteousness) as taught, endowed with faith, and regarding Me as the supreme goal—those devotees are exceedingly dear to Me.

chapters.name: Kṣetra Kṣetrajña Vibhāga Yoga
chapters.summary: The Yoga of the Discrimination between the Field and the Knower of the Field. This chapter begins with Arjuna's question regarding Prakriti (Nature) and Purusha (Spirit). Krishna defines the body as the 'Field' (Kṣetra) and the embodied soul (Ātman) as the 'Knower of the Field' (Kṣetrajña). He describes true knowledge (Jñāna) through twenty virtues, explains the nature of the Supreme Brahman, and details how the interaction between Kṣetra and Kṣetrajña gives rise to the material world and suffering, concluding with the necessity of realizing the distinction between the two for liberation.

verses.original: श्रीभगवानुवाच | इदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते | एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहुः क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विदः ||
verses.transliteration: śrībhagavān uvāca | idaṁ śarīraṁ kaunteya kṣetram ity abhidhīyate | etad yo vetti taṁ prāhuḥ kṣetrajña iti tadvidaḥ ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: O son of Kuntī (Arjuna), this body is called the Field (Kṣetra), and one who knows this body is called the Knower of the Field (Kṣetrajña) by those who know the truth.

verses.original: क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत | क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं मतं मम ||
verses.transliteration: kṣetrajñaṁ cāpi māṁ viddhi sarva-kṣetreṣu bhārata | kṣetra-kṣetrajñayor jñānaṁ yat taj jñānaṁ mataṁ mama ||

translations.english: Know Me to be the Knower of the Field in all Fields, O Bhārata (Arjuna). The understanding of the Field and the Knower of the Field—that, in My opinion, is true knowledge.

verses.original: तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक्च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत् | स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे शृणु ||
verses.transliteration: tat kṣetraṁ yac ca yādṛk ca yad-vikāri yataś ca yat | sa ca yo yat-prabhāvaś ca tat samāsena me śṛṇu ||

translations.english: Hear briefly from Me what the Field is, what its nature is, what its modifications are, from where it is born, who the Knower is, and what his powers are.

verses.original: ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधैः पृथक् | ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भिर्विनिश्चितैः ||
verses.transliteration: ṛṣibhir bahudhā gītaṁ chandobhir vividhaiḥ pṛthak | brahma-sūtra-padaiś caiva hetumadbhir viniścitaiḥ ||

translations.english: This truth has been sung in many ways by sages, separately in various Vedic hymns, and also by the decisive, reasoned aphorisms of the Brahma Sūtras.

verses.original: महाभूतान्यहङ्कारो बुद्धिरव्यक्तमेव च | इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचराः ||
verses.transliteration: mahā-bhūtāny ahaṅkāro buddhir avyaktam eva ca | indriyāṇi daśaikaṁ ca pañca ce-ndriya-gocarāḥ ||

translations.english: The great elements (Earth, Water, Fire, Air, Ether), ego (ahaṅkāra), intellect (buddhi), the unmanifested (Prakriti), the ten senses, the one (mind), and the five objects of the senses...

verses.original: इच्छा द्वेषः सुखं दुःखं सङ्घातश्चेतना धृतिः | एतत्क्षेत्रं समासेन सविकारमुदाहृतम् ||
verses.transliteration: icchā dveṣaḥ sukhaṁ duḥkhaṁ saṅghātaś cetanā dhṛtiḥ | etat kṣetraṁ samāsena sa-vikāram udāhṛtam ||

translations.english: Desire, hatred, pleasure, pain, the aggregate (body/consciousness), consciousness (cetanā), and resolve (dhṛti)—this is the Field, briefly described with its modifications.

verses.original: अमानित्वमदम्भित्वमहिंसा क्षान्तिरार्जवम् | आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रहः ||
verses.transliteration: amānitvam adambhitvam ahiṁsā kṣāntir ārjavam | ācāryopāsanaṁ śaucaṁ sthairyam ātma-vinigrahaḥ ||

translations.english: Humility (absence of pride), integrity (absence of hypocrisy), non-violence, forgiveness, uprightness, service to the guru, purity, steadfastness, and self-control...

verses.original: इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहङ्कार एव च | जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदुःखदोषानुदर्शनम् ||
verses.transliteration: indriyārtheṣu vairāgyam anahaṅkāra eva ca | janma-mṛtyu-jarā-vyādhi-duḥkha-doṣānu-darśanam ||

translations.english: Detachment from the objects of the senses, absence of egoism, and constant reflection on the pain and evil inherent in birth, death, old age, and sickness...

verses.original: असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्गः पुत्रदारगृहादिषु | नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु ||
verses.transliteration: asaktir anabhiṣvaṅgaḥ putra-dāra-gṛhādiṣu | nityaṁ ca sama-cittatvam iṣṭāniṣṭopapattiṣu ||

translations.english: Non-attachment and non-identification with son, wife, home, and the rest; constant equanimity toward pleasant and unpleasant occurrences...

verses.original: मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी | विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि ||
verses.transliteration: mayi cānanya-yogena bhaktir avyabhicāriṇī | vivikta-deśa-sevitvam aratir jana-saṁsadi ||

translations.english: ...unwavering devotion to Me by the Yoga of non-separation (exclusive focus), liking to dwell in solitude, and distaste for the company of ordinary people (social crowds)...

verses.original: अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्त्वज्ञानार्थदर्शनम् | एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा ||
verses.transliteration: adhyātma-jñāna-nityatvaṁ tattva-jñānārtha-darśanam | etaj jñānam iti proktam ajñānaṁ yad ato 'nyathā ||

translations.english: ...constancy in self-knowledge, and understanding the object of true knowledge (the Supreme Truth). All this is declared to be knowledge, and everything else is ignorance.

verses.original: ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वाऽमृतमश्नुते | अनादिमत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते ||
verses.transliteration: jñeyaṁ yat tat pravakṣyāmi yaj jñātvā 'mṛtam aśnute | anādimat paraṁ brahma na sat tan nāsad ucyate ||

translations.english: I shall now describe that which is to be known, knowing which one attains immortality. The Supreme Brahman is without beginning, subordinate to Me; It is said to be neither being (sat) nor non-being (asat).

verses.original: सर्वतः पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम् | सर्वतः श्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति ||
verses.transliteration: sarvataḥ pāṇi-pādaṁ tat sarvato 'kṣi-śiro-mukham | sarvataḥ śrutimal loke sarvam āvṛtya tiṣṭhati ||

translations.english: That has hands and feet everywhere, eyes, heads, and mouths everywhere; it has ears everywhere; it exists in the world, pervading everything.

verses.original: सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम् | असक्तं सर्वभृच्चैव निर्गुणं गुणभोक्तृ च ||
verses.transliteration: sarve-ndriya-guṇābhāsaṁ sarve-ndriya-vivarjitam | asaktaṁ sarva-bhṛc caiva nirguṇaṁ guṇa-bhoktṛ ca ||

translations.english: It appears to possess the qualities of all senses, yet it is without any senses; it is unattached, yet the maintainer of all; it is without qualities (guṇas), yet the enjoyer of the qualities.

verses.original: बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च | सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत् ||
verses.transliteration: bahir antaś ca bhūtānām acaraṁ caram eva ca | sūkṣmatvāt tad avijñeyaṁ dūrasthaṁ cāntike ca tat ||

translations.english: It exists outside and inside all beings, animate and inanimate. Because of its subtlety, it is incomprehensible; it is far away, yet it is near.

verses.original: अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम् | भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च ||
verses.transliteration: avibhaktaṁ ca bhūteṣu vibhaktam iva ca sthitam | bhūta-bhartṛ ca taj jñeyaṁ grasiṣṇu prabhaviṣṇu ca ||

translations.english: Though undivided, it appears to be divided among beings. That which is to be known is the supporter of all beings; it devours and it generates.

verses.original: ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमसः परमुच्यते | ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य धिष्ठितम् ||
verses.transliteration: jyotiṣām api taj jyotis tamasaḥ param ucyate | jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ jñāna-gamyaṁ hṛdi sarvasya dhiṣṭhitam ||

translations.english: It is the Light of all lights, said to be beyond darkness. It is Knowledge, the Object of Knowledge, and that which is to be attained by Knowledge. It is seated in the hearts of all.

verses.original: इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासतः | मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते ||
verses.transliteration: iti kṣetraṁ tathā jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ coktaṁ samāsataḥ | mad-bhakta etad vijñāya mad-bhāvāyopapadyate ||

translations.english: Thus, the Field, Knowledge, and the Object of Knowledge have been briefly described. My devotee, knowing this, becomes qualified for My nature (attains My state of being).

verses.original: प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि | विकारਾਂश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसम्भवान् ||
verses.transliteration: prakṛtiṁ puruṣaṁ caiva viddhy anādī ubhāv api | vikārāṁś ca guṇāṁś caiva viddhi prakṛti-sambhavān ||

translations.english: Know that Nature (Prakṛti) and the enjoyer (Puruṣa) are both beginningless. Know also that all modifications (vikāra) and all qualities (guṇa) are born of Prakṛti.

verses.original: कार्यकारणकर्तृत्वे हेतुः प्रकृतिरुच्यते | पुरुषः सुखदुःखानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते ||
verses.transliteration: kārya-kāraṇa-kartṛtve hetuḥ prakṛtir ucyate | puruṣaḥ sukha-duḥkhānāṁ bhoktṛtve hetur ucyate ||

translations.english: In the production of the body (kārya) and the senses (kāraṇa), Prakṛti is said to be the cause. In the experience of pleasure and pain, Puruṣa is said to be the cause.

verses.original: पुरुषः प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान् | कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु ||
verses.transliteration: puruṣaḥ prakṛti-stho hi bhuṅkte prakṛti-jān guṇān | kāraṇaṁ guṇa-saṅgo 'sya sad-asad-yoni-janmasu ||

translations.english: The Puruṣa, residing in Prakṛti, experiences the qualities born of Prakṛti. Attachment to these qualities is the cause of its birth in good and evil wombs.

verses.original: उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वरः | परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुषः परः ||
verses.transliteration: upadraṣṭānumantā ca bhartā bhoktā maheśvaraḥ | paramātmeti cāpy ukto dehe 'smin puruṣaḥ paraḥ ||

translations.english: The Supreme Puruṣa in this body is also called the Witness (Upadraṣṭā), the Approver (Anumantā), the Supporter (Bhartā), the Enjoyer (Bhoktā), the Great Lord (Maheśvara), and the Supreme Self (Paramātmā).

verses.original: य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणैः सह | सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते ||
verses.transliteration: ya evaṁ vetti puruṣaṁ prakṛtiṁ ca guṇaiḥ saha | sarvathā vartamāno 'pi na sa bhūyo 'bhijāyate ||

translations.english: He who thus knows the Puruṣa and Prakṛti with its qualities, even though performing all kinds of actions, is not born again.

verses.original: ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मना | अन्ये साङ्ख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे ||
verses.transliteration: dhyānenātmani paśyanti kecid ātmānam ātmanā | anye sāṅkhyena yogena karma-yogena cāpare ||

translations.english: Some perceive the Self (Ātman) by the self through meditation (Dhyāna Yoga); others through the Yoga of Knowledge (Sāṅkhya Yoga); and yet others through the Yoga of Action (Karma Yoga).

verses.original: अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्तः श्रुत्वान्येभ्य उपासते | तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणाः ||
verses.transliteration: anye tv evam ajānantaḥ śrutvānyebhya upāsate | te 'pi cātitaranty eva mṛtyuṁ śruti-parāyaṇāḥ ||

translations.english: Others, not knowing this truth directly, worship by hearing from others. They also cross beyond death, being dedicated to what they have heard.

verses.original: यावत्सञ्जायते किञ्चित्सत्त्वं स्थावरजङ्गमम् | क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञसंयोगात्तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ ||
verses.transliteration: yāvat saṁjāyate kiñcit sattvaṁ sthāvara-jaṅgamam | kṣetra-kṣetrajña-saṁyogāt tad viddhi bharatarṣabha ||

translations.english: Whatever being, moving or non-moving, is born, know that it arises from the union of the Field and the Knower of the Field, O best of the Bhāratas (Arjuna).

verses.original: समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम् | विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं यः पश्यति स पश्यति ||
verses.transliteration: samaṁ sarveṣu bhūteṣu tiṣṭhantaṁ parameśvaram | vinaśyatsv avinaśyantaṁ yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati ||

translations.english: He sees truly who sees the Supreme Lord (Parameśvara) existing equally in all beings, the Imperishable within the perishing.

verses.original: समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम् | न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम् ||
verses.transliteration: samaṁ paśyan hi sarvatra samavasthitam īśvaram | na hinasty ātmanātmānaṁ tato yāti parāṁ gatim ||

translations.english: Because he sees the Lord present everywhere equally, he does not degrade the self by the self; therefore, he attains the supreme goal.

verses.original: प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वशः | यः पश्यति तथात्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति ||
verses.transliteration: prakṛtyaiva ca karmāṇi kriyamāṇāni sarvaśaḥ | yaḥ paśyati tathātmānam akartāraṁ sa paśyati ||

translations.english: He sees truly who perceives that all actions are performed only by Prakṛti (Nature), and that the Self (Ātman) is not the doer.

verses.original: यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति | तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते तदा ||
verses.transliteration: yadā bhūta-pṛthag-bhāvam eka-stham anupaśyati | tata eva ca vistāraṁ brahma sampadyate tadā ||

translations.english: When he sees the diverse nature of beings rooted in the one (Prakṛti) and perceives the expansion from that very one, then he attains Brahman.

verses.original: अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्ययः | शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते ||
verses.transliteration: anāditvān nirguṇatvāt paramātmāyam avyayaḥ | śarīra-stho 'pi kaunteya na karoti na lipyate ||

translations.english: Because of being without beginning and without qualities (guṇas), the imperishable Supreme Self (Paramātmā), though residing in the body, O son of Kuntī, neither acts nor is tainted.

verses.original: यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते | सर्वत्रावस्थितो देहे तथात्मा नोपलिप्यते ||
verses.transliteration: yathā sarva-gataṁ saukṣmyād ākāśaṁ nopalipyate | sarvatrāvasthito dehe tathātmā nopalipyate ||

translations.english: Just as the all-pervading ether (ākāśa), due to its subtlety, is not stained, so too, the Self (Ātman), though situated everywhere in the body, is not tainted.

verses.original: यथा प्रकाशयत्येकः कृत्स्नं लोकमिमं रविः | क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नं प्रकाशयति भारत ||
verses.transliteration: yathā prakāśayaty ekaḥ kṛtsnaṁ lokam imaṁ raviḥ | kṣetraṁ kṣetrī tathā kṛtsnaṁ prakāśayati bhārata ||

translations.english: Just as the single sun illuminates this entire world, so the Knower of the Field (Kṣetrī) illuminates the entire Field (Kṣetra), O Bhārata.

verses.original: क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवमन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा | भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम् ||
verses.transliteration: kṣetra-kṣetrajñayor evam antaraṁ jñāna-cakṣuṣā | bhūta-prakṛti-mokṣaṁ ca ye vidur yānti te param ||

translations.english: Those who perceive the distinction between the Field and the Knower of the Field with the eye of knowledge, and also the liberation of beings from Prakṛti (material Nature), attain the Supreme.

verses.original: इति श्रीमहाभारते शतसाहस्र्यां संहितायां वैयासिक्यां भीष्मपर्वणि श्रीमद्भगवद्गीतासूपनिषत्सु ब्रह्मविद्यायां योगशास्त्रे श्रीकृष्णार्जुनसंवादे क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञविभागयोगो नाम त्रयोदशोऽध्यायः ||
verses.transliteration: iti śrī-mahābhārate śata-sāhasryāṁ saṁhitāyāṁ vaiyāsikyāṁ bhīṣma-parvaṇi śrīmad-bhagavad-gītāsūpaniṣatsu brahma-vidyāyāṁ yoga-śāstre śrī-kṛṣṇārjuna-saṁvāde kṣetra-kṣetrajña-vibhāga-yogo nāma trayodaśo 'dhyāyaḥ ||

translations.english: Thus, in the Śrīmad Bhagavad Gītā Upaniṣad, the science of the Absolute, the scripture of Yoga, the dialogue between Śrī Kṛṣṇa and Arjuna, the thirteenth chapter titled Kṣetra Kṣetrajña Vibhāga Yoga (The Yoga of the Discrimination between the Field and the Knower of the Field) is concluded.

chapters.name: Guṇa Traya Vibhāga Yoga
chapters.summary: The Yoga of the Division of the Three Qualities. Krishna elaborates on the three material modes of Nature (Sattva, Rajas, and Tamas) and how they bind the eternal soul to the body. He describes the distinguishing characteristics of each guṇa, how they influence action and knowledge, and the ultimate destiny they lead to. The chapter concludes by defining the traits of one who has transcended the guṇas (guṇātīta) and achieved liberation through unwavering devotion.

verses.original: श्रीभगवानुवाच | परं भूयः प्रवक्ष्यामि ज्ञानानां ज्ञानमुत्तमम् | यज्ज्ञात्वा मुनयः सर्वे परां सिद्धिमितो गताः ||
verses.transliteration: śrībhagavān uvāca | paraṁ bhūyaḥ pravakṣyāmi jñānānāṁ jñānam uttamam | yaj jñātvā munayaḥ sarve parāṁ siddhim ito gatāḥ ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: I shall declare again the supreme knowledge, the best of all knowledge, knowing which all the sages attained the highest perfection from this world.

verses.original: इदं ज्ञानमुपाश्रित्य मम साधर्म्यमागताः | सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च ||
verses.transliteration: idaṁ jñānam upāśritya mama sādharmyam āgatāḥ | sarge 'pi nopajāyante pralaye na vyathanti ca ||

translations.english: Those who take refuge in this knowledge attain a nature similar to Mine. They are not born again at the time of creation, nor are they disturbed at the time of dissolution.

verses.original: मम योनिर्महद्ब्रह्म तस्मिन्गर्भं दधाम्यहम् | संभवः सर्वभूतानां ततो भवति भारत ||
verses.transliteration: mama yonir mahad brahma tasmin garbhaṁ dadhāmy aham | saṁbhavaḥ sarva-bhūtānāṁ tato bhavati bhārata ||

translations.english: My great Nature (Prakṛti) is the womb; in that I place the seed (the consciousness of all beings). From this, the birth of all beings takes place, O Bhārata.

verses.original: सर्वयोनिषु कौन्तेय मूर्तयः सम्भवन्ति याः | तासां ब्रह्म महद्योनिरहं बीजप्रदः पिता ||
verses.transliteration: sarva-yoniṣu kaunteya mūrtayaḥ saṁbhavanti yāḥ | tāsāṁ brahma mahad yonir ahaṁ bīja-pradaḥ pitā ||

translations.english: O son of Kuntī, whatever forms are produced in any species, the great Brahman (Prakṛti) is their womb, and I am the seed-giving father.

verses.original: सत्त्वं रजस्तम इति गुणाः प्रकृतिसम्भवाः | निबध्नन्ति महाबाहो देहे देहिनमव्ययम् ||
verses.transliteration: sattvaṁ rajas tama iti guṇāḥ prakṛti-saṁbhavāḥ | nibadhnanti mahā-bāho dehe dehinam avyayam ||

translations.english: Sattva (goodness), Rajas (passion), and Tamas (ignorance)—these qualities, born of Nature (Prakṛti), O mighty-armed (Arjuna), bind the eternal embodied soul to the body.

verses.original: तत्र सत्त्वं निर्मलत्वात्प्रकाशकमनामयम् | सुखसङ्गेन बध्नाति ज्ञानसङ्गेन चानघ ||
verses.transliteration: tatra sattvaṁ nirmalatvāt prakāśakam anāmayam | sukha-saṅgena badhnāti jñāna-saṅgena cānagha ||

translations.english: Among these, Sattva, being pure, illuminating, and free from distress, binds by attachment to happiness and attachment to knowledge, O sinless one (Arjuna).

verses.original: रजो रागात्मकं विद्धि तृष्णासङ्गसमुद्भवम् | तन्निबध्नाति कौन्तेय कर्मसङ्गेन देहिनम् ||
verses.transliteration: rajo rāgātmakaṁ viddhi tṛṣṇā-saṅga-samudbhavam | tan nibadhnāti kaunteya karma-saṅgena dehinam ||

translations.english: Know Rajas to be the nature of passion, arising from craving and attachment. O son of Kuntī, that binds the embodied soul by attachment to action.

verses.original: तमस्त्वज्ञानजं विद्धि मोहनं सर्वदेहिनाम् | प्रमादालस्यनिद्राभिस्तन्निबध्नाति भारत ||
verses.transliteration: tamas tv ajñāna-jaṁ viddhi mohanaṁ sarva-dehinām | pramādālasya-nidrābhis tan nibadhnāti bhārata ||

translations.english: Know Tamas to be born of ignorance, deluding all embodied beings. O Bhārata, that binds by heedlessness, laziness, and sleep.

verses.original: सत्त्वं सुखे सञ्जयति रजः कर्मणि भारत | ज्ञानमावृत्य तु तमः प्रमादे सञ्जयत्युत ||
verses.transliteration: sattvaṁ sukhe sañjayati rajaḥ karmaṇi bhārata | jñānam āvṛtya tu tamaḥ pramāde sañjayaty uta ||

translations.english: Sattva attaches one to happiness, Rajas to action, O Bhārata. But Tamas, covering knowledge, attaches one to heedlessness (carelessness).

verses.original: रजस्तमश्चाभिभूय सत्त्वं भवति भारत | रजः सत्त्वं तमश्चैव तमः सत्त्वं रजस्तथा ||
verses.transliteration: rajas tamaś cābhibhūya sattvaṁ bhavati bhārata | rajaḥ sattvaṁ tamaś caiva tamaḥ sattvaṁ rajas tathā ||

translations.english: Sometimes Sattva prevails, overpowering Rajas and Tamas, O Bhārata; sometimes Rajas, overpowering Sattva and Tamas; and sometimes Tamas, overpowering Sattva and Rajas.

verses.original: सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते | ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्याद्विवृद्धं सत्त्वमित्युत ||
verses.transliteration: sarva-dvāreṣu dehe 'smin prakāśa upajāyate | jñānaṁ yadā tadā vidyād vivṛddhaṁ sattvam ity uta ||

translations.english: When the light of knowledge shines forth from all the gates (senses) in this body, then one should know that Sattva is predominant.

verses.original: लोभः प्रवृत्तिरारम्भः कर्मणामशमः स्पृहा | रजस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे भरतर्षभ ||
verses.transliteration: lobhaḥ pravṛttir ārambhaḥ karmaṇām aśamaḥ spṛhā | rajasy etāni jāyante vivṛddhe bharatarṣabha ||
