translations.english: Greed, activity, restless undertaking of actions, lack of peace, and craving—these arise when Rajas is predominant, O best of the Bhāratas.

verses.original: अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च | तमस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे कुरुनन्दन ||
verses.transliteration: aprakāśo 'pravṛttiś ca pramādo moha eva ca | tamasy etāni jāyante vivṛddhe kuru-nandana ||

translations.english: Darkness (ignorance), inactivity, heedlessness (carelessness), and delusion—these arise when Tamas is predominant, O delight of the Kurus (Arjuna).

verses.original: यदा सत्त्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत् | तदोत्तमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते ||
verses.transliteration: yadā sattve pravṛddhe tu pralayaṁ yāti deha-bhṛt | tadottamavidāṁ lokān amalaan pratipadyate ||

translations.english: If the embodied being meets death when Sattva is predominant, he attains the pure worlds of those who know the Supreme.

verses.original: रजसि प्रलयं गत्वा कर्मसङ्गिषु जायते | तथा प्रलीनस्तमसि मूढयोनिषु जायते ||
verses.transliteration: rajasi pralayaṁ gatvā karma-saṅgiṣu jāyate | tathā pralīnas tamasi mūḍha-yoniṣu jāyate ||

translations.english: If the embodied being dies when Rajas is predominant, he is born among those attached to action. If he dies when Tamas is predominant, he is born in the wombs of the ignorant (lower species).

verses.original: कर्मणः सुकृतस्याहुः सात्त्विकं निर्मलं फलम् | रजसस्तु फलं दुःखमज्ञानं तमसः फलम् ||
verses.transliteration: karmaṇaḥ sukṛtasyāhuḥ sāttvikaṁ nirmalaṁ phalam | rajasas tu phalaṁ duḥkham ajñānaṁ tamasaḥ phalam ||

translations.english: The fruit of good action is said to be Sattvic and pure; the fruit of Rajas is pain; and the fruit of Tamas is ignorance.

verses.original: सत्त्वात्सञ्जायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च | प्रमादमोहौ तमसः भवतः अज्ञानमेव च ||
verses.transliteration: sattvāt sañjāyate jñānaṁ rajaso lobha eva ca | pramāda-mohau tamasaḥ bhavataḥ ajñānam eva ca ||

translations.english: From Sattva arises knowledge, and from Rajas arises greed; carelessness and delusion, and also ignorance, arise from Tamas.

verses.original: ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्त्वस्था मध्ये तिष्ठन्ति राजसाः | जघन्यगुणवृत्तिस्था अधो गच्छन्ति तामसाः ||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvaṁ gacchanti sattva-sthā madhye tiṣṭhanti rājasāḥ | jaghanya-guṇa-vṛttisthā adho gacchanti tāmasāḥ ||

translations.english: Those situated in Sattva go upward; the Rājasa remain in the middle; and the Tāmasa, abiding in the lowest mode of activity, go downward.

verses.original: नान्यं गुणेभ्यः कर्तारं यदा द्रष्टानुपश्यति | गुणेभ्यश्च परं वेत्ति मद्भावं सोऽधिगच्छति ||
verses.transliteration: nānyaṁ guṇebhyaḥ kartāraṁ yadā draṣṭā anupaśyati | guṇebhyaś ca paraṁ vetti mad-bhāvaṁ so 'dhigacchati ||

translations.english: When the observer perceives no agent other than the qualities (guṇas), and knows that which is superior to the guṇas, he attains My nature.

verses.original: गुणानेतानतीत्य त्रीन्देही देहसमुद्भवान् | जन्ममृत्युजरादुःखैर्विमुक्तोऽमृतमश्नुते ||
verses.transliteration: guṇān etān atītya trīn dehī deha-samudbhavān | janma-mṛtyu-jarā-duḥkhair vimukto 'mṛtam aśnute ||

translations.english: The embodied soul, transcending these three qualities that originate from the body, becomes free from the distresses of birth, death, and old age, and attains immortality.

verses.original: अर्जुन उवाच | कैर्लिङ्गैस्त्रीन्गुणानेतानतीतो भवति प्रभो | किमाचारः कथं चैतांस्त्रीन्गुणानतिवर्तते ||
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca | kair liṅgais trīn guṇān etān atīto bhavati prabho | kim ācāraḥ kathaṁ caitāṁs trīn guṇān ativartate ||

translations.english: Arjuna said: What are the marks of him who has gone beyond these three qualities, O Lord? What is his conduct, and how does he transcend these three qualities?

verses.original: श्रीभगवानुवाच | प्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव | न द्वेष्टि सम्प्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ्क्षति ||
verses.transliteration: śrībhagavān uvāca | prakāśaṁ ca pravṛttiṁ ca moham eva ca pāṇḍava | na dveṣṭi sampravṛttāni na nivṛttāni kāṅkṣati ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: O son of Pāṇḍu, he who does not hate illumination (Sattva), activity (Rajas), or delusion (Tamas) when they arise, nor longs for them when they cease...

verses.original: उदासीनवदासीनो गुणैर्यो न विचाल्यते | गुणा वर्तन्त इत्येव योऽवतिष्ठति नेङ्गते ||
verses.transliteration: udāsīnavad āsīno guṇair yo na vicālyate | guṇā vartanta ity eva yo 'vatiṣṭhati neṅgate ||

translations.english: ...he who remains seated like a neutral person, is not disturbed by the qualities, and who stays firm, knowing 'the qualities alone are acting,' and does not waver...

verses.original: समदुःखसुखः स्वस्थः समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः | तुल्यप्रियाप्रियो धीरस्तुल्यनिन्दात्मसंस्तुतिः ||
verses.transliteration: sama-duḥkha-sukhaḥ svasthaḥ sama-loṣṭāśma-kāñcanaḥ | tulya-priyāpriyo dhīras tulya-nindātma-saṁstutiḥ ||

translations.english: ...he who is equal in sorrow and joy, self-abiding, to whom a lump of earth, stone, and gold are the same; who is the same to the dear and the undesirable; who is steady, and the same in censure and praise...

verses.original: मानापमानयोस्तुल्यस्तुल्यो मित्रारिपक्षयोः | सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी गुणातीतः स उच्यते ||
verses.transliteration: mānāpamānayos tulyas tulyo mitrāri-pakṣayoḥ | sarvārambha-parityāgī guṇātītaḥ sa ucyate ||

translations.english: ...he who is equal in honor and dishonor, equal to the side of friends and enemies, and who has renounced all undertakings (for the sake of results)—that person is said to have transcended the qualities (guṇātīta).

verses.original: मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते | स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान् ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ||
verses.transliteration: māṁ ca yo 'vyabhicāreṇa bhakti-yogena sevate | sa guṇān samatītyaitān brahma-bhūyāya kalpate ||

translations.english: And he who serves Me with unswerving devotion (Bhakti Yoga), transcends these qualities and is qualified for union with Brahman (Brahma-bhūyāya).

verses.original: ब्रह्मणो हि प्रतिष्ठाहममृतस्याव्ययस्य च | शाश्वतस्य च धर्मस्य सुखस्यैकान्तिकस्य च ||
verses.transliteration: brahmaṇo hi pratiṣṭhāham amṛtasyāvyayasya ca | śāśvatasya ca dharmasya sukhasyaikāntikasya ca ||

translations.english: For I am the basis of the impersonal Brahman, which is immortal and immutable, and the basis of eternal Dharma, and of absolute, ultimate happiness.

chapters.name: Puruṣottama Yoga
chapters.summary: The Yoga of the Supreme Person. This chapter begins with a metaphorical description of the material world as an Ashvattha tree (the upside-down Peepal tree), whose roots are above and branches below. Krishna then describes how this tree of samsara (repeated birth and death) must be cut down by the axe of detachment. He explains the nature of the individual soul (Jīva), its relationship with the material body, and concludes by identifying the three types of 'persons' (Kṣara, Akṣara, and Puruṣottama), revealing Himself as the Supreme Person.

verses.original: श्रीभगवानुवाच | ऊर्ध्वमूलमधःशाखमश्वत्थं प्राहुरव्ययम् | छन्दांसि यस्य पर्णानि यस्तं वेद स वेदवित् ||
verses.transliteration: śrībhagavān uvāca | ūrdhva-mūlam adhaḥ-śākham aśvatthaṁ prāhur avyayam | chandāṁsi yasya parṇāni yas taṁ veda sa vedavit ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: They speak of the imperishable fig tree (aśvattha) having its roots above and its branches below; the Vedic hymns are its leaves. He who knows this tree is the knower of the Vedas.

verses.original: अधश्चोर्ध्वं प्रसृतास्तस्य शाखा गुणप्रवृद्धा विषयप्रवालाः | अधश्च मूलान्यनुसन्ततानि कर्मानुबन्धीनि मनुष्यलोके ||
verses.transliteration: adhaś cordhvaṁ prasṛtās tasya śākhā guṇa-pravṛddhā viṣaya-pravālāḥ | adhaś ca mūlāny anusantatāni karmānubandhīni manuṣya-loke ||

translations.english: Its branches, nourished by the guṇas (qualities of nature), extend below and above, with the sense objects as its tender shoots. Its secondary roots stretch down into the human world, leading to actions (karma) that result in bondage.

verses.original: न रूपमस्येह तथोपलभ्यते नान्तो न चादिर्न च सम्प्रतिष्ठा | अश्वत्थमेनं सुविरूढमूलमसङ्गशस्त्रेण दृढेन छित्त्वा ||
verses.transliteration: na rūpam asyeha tathopalabhyate nānto na cādir na ca sampratiṣṭhā | aśvattham enaṁ suvirūḍha-mūlam asaṅga-śastreṇa dṛḍhena chittvā ||

translations.english: Its true form is not perceived here, nor is its end, its beginning, nor its foundation. Having cut down this firm-rooted fig tree with the strong weapon of detachment...

verses.original: ततः पदं तत्परिमार्गितव्यं यस्मिन्गता न निवर्तन्ति भूयः | तमेव चाद्यं पुरुषं प्रपद्ये यतः प्रवृत्तिः प्रसृता पुराणी ||
verses.transliteration: tataḥ padaṁ tat parimārgitavyaṁ yasmin gatā na nivartanti bhūyaḥ | tam eva cādyaṁ puruṣaṁ prapadye yataḥ pravṛttiḥ prasṛtā purāṇī ||

translations.english: ...thereafter, that goal should be sought, reaching which one does not return again. One should surrender to that Primal Person from whom this ancient flow (of creation) has emanated.

verses.original: निर्मानमोहा जितसङ्गदोषा अध्यात्मनित्या विनिवृत्तकामाः | द्वन्द्वैर्विमुक्ताः सुखदुःखसंज्ञैर्गच्छन्त्यमूढाः पदमव्ययं तत् ||
verses.transliteration: nirmāna-mohā jita-saṅga-doṣā adhyātma-nityā vinivṛtta-kāmāḥ | dvandvair vimuktāḥ sukha-duḥkha-saṁjñair gacchanty amūḍhāḥ padam avyayaṁ tat ||

translations.english: Those free from pride and delusion, who have conquered the flaw of attachment, who are constantly engaged in spiritual knowledge, whose desires have completely ceased, and who are liberated from the dualities named pleasure and pain—those undeluded ones attain that imperishable state.

verses.original: न तद्भासयते सूर्यो न शशाङ्को न पावकः | यद्गत्वा न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ||
verses.transliteration: na tad bhāsayate sūryo na śaśāṅko na pāvakaḥ | yad gatvā na nivartante tad dhāma paramaṁ mama ||

translations.english: That state, which is not illumined by the sun, nor the moon, nor fire, is My supreme abode. Those who reach it do not return.

verses.original: ममैवांशो जीवलोके जीवभूतः सनातनः | मनःषष्ठानीन्द्रियाणि प्रकृतिस्थानि कर्षति ||
verses.transliteration: mamaivāṁśo jīva-loke jīva-bhūtaḥ sanātanaḥ | manaḥ-ṣaṣṭhānī-ndriyāṇi prakṛti-sthāni karṣati ||

translations.english: An eternal part of Myself, having become the individual soul (Jīva) in the world of living beings, draws to itself the five senses and the mind, which rest in Nature (Prakṛti).

verses.original: शरीरं यदवाप्नोति यच्चाप्युत्क्रामतीश्वरः | गृहीत्वैतानि संयाति वायुर्गन्धानिवाशयात् ||
verses.transliteration: śarīraṁ yad avāpnoti yac cāpy utkrāmatīśvaraḥ | gṛhītvaitāni saṁyāti vāyur gandhān ivāśayāt ||

translations.english: When the Lord (the soul) acquires a body and when he leaves it, he takes these (the senses and mind) and goes, just as the wind carries aromas from their source.

verses.original: श्रोत्रं चक्षुः स्पर्शनं च रसनं घ्राणमेव च | अधिष्ठाय मनश्चायं विषयानुपसेवते ||
verses.transliteration: śrotraṁ cakṣuḥ sparśanaṁ ca rasanaṁ ghrāṇam eva ca | adhiṣṭhāya manaś cāyaṁ viṣayān upasevate ||

translations.english: The individual soul, dwelling in the ear, the eye, the sense of touch, taste, and smell, as well as the mind, enjoys the objects of the senses.

verses.original: उत्क्रामन्तं स्थितं वापि भुञ्जानं वा गुणान्वितम् | विमूढा नानुपश्यन्ति पश्यन्ति ज्ञानचक्षुषः ||
verses.transliteration: utkrāmantaṁ sthitaṁ vāpi bhuñjānaṁ vā guṇānvitam | vimūḍhā nānupaśyanti paśyanti jñāna-cakṣuṣaḥ ||

translations.english: The deluded (unwise) do not perceive the soul when it departs from the body, nor when it stays, nor when it enjoys, being associated with the guṇas. But those who possess the eye of knowledge (Jñāna-cakṣuṣaḥ) see it.

verses.original: यतन्तो योगिनश्चैनं पश्यन्त्यात्मन्यवस्थितम् | यतन्तोऽप्यकृतात्मानो नैनं पश्यन्त्यचेतसः ||
verses.transliteration: yatanto yoginaś cainaṁ paśyanty ātmany avasthitam | yatanto 'py akṛtātmāno nainaṁ paśyanty acetasaḥ ||

translations.english: Yogis who strive perceive the Self situated within themselves. But those whose minds are not refined (akṛtātmānaḥ), even though striving, do not perceive it.

verses.original: यदादित्यगतं तेजो जगद्भासयतेऽखिलम् | यच्चन्द्रमसि यच्चाग्नौ तत्तेजो विद्धि मामकम् ||
verses.transliteration: yad āditya-gataṁ tejo jagad bhāsayate 'khilam | yac candramasi yac cāgnau tat tejo viddhi māmakam ||

translations.english: The splendor that dwells in the sun and illumines the whole world, and the light in the moon and the fire—know that splendor to be Mine.

verses.original: गामाविश्य च भूतानि धारयाम्यहमोजसा | पुष्णामि चौषधीः सर्वाः सोमो भूत्वा रसात्मकः ||
verses.transliteration: gām āviśya ca bhūtāni dhārayāmy aham ojasā | puṣṇāmi cauṣadhīḥ sarvāḥ somo bhūtvā rasātmakaḥ ||

translations.english: Entering the earth, I sustain all beings with My energy. And becoming the watery moon, I nourish all vegetation.

verses.original: अहं वैश्वानरो भूत्वा प्राणिनां देहमाश्रितः | प्राणापानसमायुक्तः पचाम्यन्नं चतुर्विधम् ||
verses.transliteration: ahaṁ vaiśvānaro bhūtvā prāṇināṁ deham āśritaḥ | prāṇāpāna-samāyuktaḥ pacāmy annaṁ catur-vidham ||

translations.english: Becoming the fire of digestion (Vaiśvānara), I reside in the bodies of all living beings, and united with the incoming (prāṇa) and outgoing (apāna) breaths, I digest the four kinds of food.

verses.original: सर्वस्य चाहं हृदि संनिविष्टो मत्तः स्मृतिर्ज्ञानमपोहनं च | वेदैश्च सर्वैरहमेव वेद्यो वेदान्तकृद्वेदविदेव चाहम् ||
verses.transliteration: sarvasya cāhaṁ hṛdi saṁniviṣṭo mattaḥ smṛtir jñānam apohanaṁ ca | vedaiś ca sarvair aham eva vedyo vedānta-kṛd veda-vid eva cāham ||

translations.english: I am seated in the hearts of all. From Me come memory, knowledge, and their removal (forgetfulness). I alone am to be known through all the Vedas; I am indeed the compiler of the Vedānta, and the knower of the Vedas.

verses.original: द्वाविमौ पुरुषौ लोके क्षरश्चाक्षर एव च | क्षरः सर्वाणि भूतानि कूटस्थोऽक्षर उच्यते ||
verses.transliteration: dvāv imau puruṣau loke kṣaraś cākṣara eva ca | kṣaraḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni kūṭastho 'kṣara ucyate ||

translations.english: There are two kinds of persons in the world: the perishable (kṣara) and the imperishable (akṣara). The perishable consists of all beings, and the imperishable is called the unchanging one (kūṭastha).

verses.original: उत्तमः पुरुषस्त्वन्यः परमात्मेत्युदाहृतः | यो लोकत्रयमाविश्य बिभर्त्यव्यय ईश्वरः ||
verses.transliteration: uttamaḥ puruṣas tv anyaḥ paramātmety udāhṛtaḥ | yo loka-trayam āviśya bibharty avyaya īśvaraḥ ||

translations.english: But there is another, the Supreme Person (Puruṣottama), who is called the Supreme Self (Paramātmā), the imperishable Lord who enters the three worlds and sustains them.

verses.original: यस्मात्क्षरमतीतोऽहमक्षरादपि चोत्तमः | अतोऽस्मि लोके वेदे च प्रथितः पुरुषोत्तमः ||
verses.transliteration: yasmāt kṣaram atīto 'ham akṣarād api cottamaḥ | ato 'smi loke vede ca prathitaḥ puruṣottamaḥ ||

translations.english: Because I am transcendental to the perishable and superior even to the imperishable, I am celebrated in the world and in the Vedas as the Supreme Person (Puruṣottama).

verses.original: यो मामेवमसंमूढो जानाति पुरुषोत्तमम् | स सर्वविद्भजति मां सर्वभावेन भारत ||
verses.transliteration: yo mām evam asaṁmūḍho jānāti puruṣottamam | sa sarva-vid bhajati māṁ sarva-bhāvena bhārata ||

translations.english: He who, without delusion, knows Me as the Supreme Person (Puruṣottama) is the knower of everything and worships Me with his whole being, O Bhārata.

verses.original: इति गुह्यतमं शास्त्रमिदमुक्तं मयानघ | एतद्बुद्ध्वा बुद्धिमान्स्यात्कृतकृत्यश्च भारत ||
verses.transliteration: iti guhyatamaṁ śāstram idam uktaṁ mayānagha | etad buddhvā buddhimān syāt kṛta-kṛtyaś ca bhārata ||

translations.english: Thus, this most confidential part of the scriptures has been declared by Me, O sinless one (Arjuna). Having understood this, a person becomes wise and achieves all his objectives, O Bhārata.

chapters.name: Daivāsura Sampad Vibhāga Yoga
chapters.summary: The Yoga of the Division between Divine and Demonic Natures. Krishna describes the two types of human nature: the divine (Daivī Sampad), which leads to liberation, and the demonic (Āsurī Sampad), which leads to bondage and hellish existence. He lists the twenty-six divine qualities (virtues) and highlights the typical traits, attitudes, and destiny of the demonic. The chapter concludes by naming lust, anger, and greed as the three gates to hell, and emphasizes the importance of following scripture (Śāstra) for guidance.

verses.original: श्रीभगवानुवाच | अभयं सत्त्वसंशुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थितिः | दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम् ||
verses.transliteration: śrībhagavān uvāca | abhayaṁ sattva-saṁśuddhir jñāna-yoga-vyavasthitiḥ | dānaṁ damaś ca yajñaś ca svādhyāyas tapa ārjavam ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: Fearlessness, purification of one's existence, steadfastness in knowledge and Yoga, charity, self-control, performance of sacrifice, study of the Vedas, austerity, and straightforwardness...

verses.original: अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्यागः शान्तिरपैशुनम् | दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम् ||
verses.transliteration: ahiṁsā satyam akrodhas tyāgaḥ śāntir apaiśunam | dayā bhūteṣv aloluptvaṁ mārdavaṁ hrīr acāpalam ||

translations.english: Non-violence, truthfulness, absence of anger, renunciation, peacefulness, aversion to fault-finding, compassion toward all beings, freedom from covetousness, gentleness, modesty, and lack of restlessness...

verses.original: तेजः क्षमा धृतिः शौचमद्रोहो नातिमानिता | भवन्ति सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत ||
verses.transliteration: tejaḥ kṣamā dhṛtiḥ śaucam adroho nātimānitā | bhavanti sampadaṁ daivīm abhijātasya bhārata ||

translations.english: Vigor, forgiveness, fortitude, purity, freedom from malice, and absence of excessive pride—these belong to one born into the divine nature, O Bhārata.

verses.original: दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोधः पारुष्यमेव च | अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ सम्पदमासुरीम् ||
verses.transliteration: dambho darpo 'bhimānaś ca krodhaḥ pāruṣyam eva ca | ajñānaṁ cābhijātasya pārtha sampadam āsurīm ||

translations.english: Hypocrisy, arrogance, conceit, anger, harshness, and ignorance—these belong to one born into the demonic nature, O son of Pṛthā (Arjuna).

verses.original: दैवी सम्पद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता | मा शुचः सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव ||
verses.transliteration: daivī sampad vimokṣāya nibandhāyāsurī matā | mā śucaḥ sampadaṁ daivīm abhijāto 'si pāṇḍava ||

translations.english: The divine nature is considered to be for liberation, and the demonic nature for bondage. Do not grieve, O son of Pāṇḍu, for you are born with the divine nature.

verses.original: द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च | दैवो विस्तरशः प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे शृणु ||
verses.transliteration: dvau bhūta-sargau loke 'smin daiva āsura eva ca | daivo vistaraśaḥ prokta āsuraṁ pārtha me śṛṇu ||

translations.english: There are two types of creation in this world: the divine and the demonic. The divine has been described in detail; now hear from Me the demonic, O son of Pṛthā.

verses.original: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुराः | न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते ||
verses.transliteration: pravṛttiṁ ca nivṛttiṁ ca janā na vidur āsurāḥ | na śaucaṁ nāpi cācāro na satyaṁ teṣu vidyate ||

translations.english: Demonic people do not know what should be done (pravṛtti) and what should be abstained from (nivṛtti). Neither purity, nor proper conduct, nor truth is found in them.

verses.original: असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम् | अपरस्परसम्भूतं किमन्यत्कामहैतुकम् ||
verses.transliteration: asatyam apratiṣṭhaṁ te jagad āhur anīśvaram | aparaspara-sambhūtaṁ kim anyat kāma-haitukam ||

translations.english: They say the world is unreal, without foundation, and without a God. They claim it is born of mutual union (lust) and nothing else causes it.

verses.original: एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धयः | प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माणः क्षयाय जगतोऽहिताः ||
verses.transliteration: etāṁ dṛṣṭim avaṣṭabhya naṣṭātmāno 'lpa-buddhayaḥ | prabhavanty ugra-karmāṇaḥ kṣayāya jagato 'hitāḥ ||

translations.english: Holding onto this view, these lost souls, who are of meager intellect and cruel actions, appear as enemies for the destruction of the world.

verses.original: काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विताः | मोहाद्गृहीत्वासद्ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽशुचिव्रताः ||
verses.transliteration: kāmam āśritya duṣpūraṁ dambha-māna-madānvitāḥ | mohād gṛhītvāsad-grāhān pravartante 'śuci-vratāḥ ||

translations.english: Surrendering to insatiable lust, full of hypocrisy, conceit, and arrogance, they hold false, wicked resolutions through delusion, and act with impure vows.

verses.original: चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिताः | कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिताः ||
verses.transliteration: cintām aparimeyāṁ ca pralayāntām upāśritāḥ | kāmopabhoga-paramā etāvad iti niścitāḥ ||

translations.english: Obsessed with immeasurable anxiety that ends only with death, regarding sensual gratification as the highest goal, they are convinced that 'this is all'.

verses.original: आशापाशशतैर्बद्धाः कामक्रोधपरायणाः | ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसञ्चयान् ||
verses.transliteration: āśā-pāśa-śatair baddhāḥ kāma-krodha-parāyaṇāḥ | īhante kāma-bhogārtham anyāyenārtha-sañcayān ||

translations.english: Bound by hundreds of ties of hope, given over to lust and anger, they strive to accumulate wealth by unjust means for the gratification of their desires.

verses.original: इदमद्य मया लब्धमिदं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् | इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम् ||
verses.transliteration: idam adya mayā labdham idaṁ prāpsye manoratham | idam astīdam api me bhaviṣyati punar dhanam ||

translations.english: ‘This I have gained today; this desire I shall obtain; this wealth is mine, and this too shall be mine in the future.’

verses.original: असौ मया हतः शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि | ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी ||
verses.transliteration: asau mayā hataḥ śatrur haniṣye cāparān api | īśvaro 'ham ahaṁ bhogī siddho 'haṁ balavān sukhī ||

translations.english: ‘That enemy has been killed by me, and I shall kill the others as well. I am the lord, I am the enjoyer; I am perfect, powerful, and happy.’

verses.original: आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया | यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिताः ||
verses.transliteration: āḍhyo 'bhijanavān asmi ko 'nyo 'sti sadṛśo mayā | yakṣye dāsyāmi modiṣya ity ajñāna-vimohitāḥ ||

translations.english: ‘I am rich and born in a noble family. Who else is equal to me? I shall perform sacrifices, I shall give charity, and I shall rejoice.’ Thus deluded by ignorance...

verses.original: अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ता मोहजालसमावृताः | प्रसक्ताः कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽशुचौ ||
verses.transliteration: aneka-citta-vibhrāntā moha-jāla-samāvṛtāḥ | prasaktāḥ kāma-bhogeṣu patanti narake 'śucau ||

translations.english: Confused by numerous thoughts, entangled in the snare of delusion, and excessively attached to sensual pleasures, they fall into the foul hell.

verses.original: आत्मसम्भाविताः स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विताः | यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम् ||
verses.transliteration: ātma-sambhāvitāḥ stabdhā dhana-māna-madānvitāḥ | yajante nāma-yajñais te dambhenāvidhi-pūrvakam ||

translations.english: Self-conceited, obstinate, filled with the pride and arrogance of wealth, they perform sacrifices merely in name, out of hypocrisy, and without following scriptural injunctions.

verses.original: अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिताः | मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयकाः ||
verses.transliteration: ahaṅkāraṁ balaṁ darpaṁ kāmaṁ krodhaṁ ca saṁśritāḥ | mām ātma-para-deheṣu pradviṣanto 'bhyasūyakāḥ ||

translations.english: Clinging to egoism, power, arrogance, lust, and anger, these malicious ones hate Me, who dwell in their own bodies and the bodies of others.

verses.original: तानहं द्विषतः क्रूरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् | क्षिपाम्यजस्रमशुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु ||
verses.transliteration: tān ahaṁ dviṣataḥ krūrān saṁsāreṣu narādhamān | kṣipāmy ajasram aśubhān āsurīṣv eva yoniṣu ||

translations.english: Those who hate Me, who are cruel, the vilest among humans in the material world, I cast them repeatedly into the cycles of birth and death, only into demonic wombs.

verses.original: आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि | मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम् ||
verses.transliteration: āsurīṁ yonim āpannā mūḍhā janmani janmani | mām aprāpyaiva kaunteya tato yānty adhamāṁ gatim ||

translations.english: Having repeatedly attained demonic wombs, these deluded persons, O son of Kuntī, fail to attain Me and proceed further down into the most abominable destinations.

verses.original: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः | कामः क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत् ||
verses.transliteration: tri-vidhaṁ narakasyedaṁ dvāraṁ nāśanam ātmanaḥ | kāmaḥ krodhas tathā lobhas tasmād etat trayaṁ tyajet ||

translations.english: Three are the gates to this hell, leading to the destruction of the soul: lust, anger, and greed. Therefore, one must abandon these three.

verses.original: एतैर्विमुक्तः कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नरः | आचरत्यात्मनः श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ||
verses.transliteration: etair vimuktaḥ kaunteya tamo-dvārais tribhir naraḥ | ācaraty ātmanaḥ śreyas tato yāti parāṁ gatim ||

translations.english: The man who is liberated from these three gates of darkness (tamas), O son of Kuntī, acts for the welfare of his own self (soul) and thereby attains the supreme destination.

verses.original: यः शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारतः | न स सिद्धिमवाप्नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम् ||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ śāstra-vidhim utsṛjya vartate kāma-kārataḥ | na sa siddhim avāpnoti na sukhaṁ na parāṁ gatim ||

translations.english: He who disregards the injunctions of the scriptures (Śāstra) and acts according to his own whimsical desires does not attain perfection, nor happiness, nor the supreme goal.

verses.original: तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ | ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि ||
verses.transliteration: tasmāc chāstraṁ pramāṇaṁ te kāryā-kārya-vyavasthitau | jñātvā śāstra-vidhānoktaṁ karma kartum ihārhasi ||

translations.english: Therefore, let the scripture be your authority in determining what should be done and what should not be done. Knowing the injunctions of the scripture, you should perform your duty here (in this world).

chapters.name: Śraddhā Traya Vibhāga Yoga
chapters.summary: The Yoga of the Division of the Threefold Faith. Arjuna asks about the fate of those who worship with faith but disregard scriptural injunctions. Krishna explains that faith (śraddhā) is determined by the three guṇas (Sattva, Rajas, Tamas). He then details how these three modes affect various aspects of spiritual and material life, including food, sacrifice (Yajña), austerity (Tapas), and charity (Dāna). The chapter concludes by explaining the significance of the mantra 'Om Tat Sat' and stressing that any act of sacrifice, austerity, or charity performed without faith is worthless.

verses.original: अर्जुन उवाच | ये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः | तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तमः ||
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca | ye śāstra-vidhim utsṛjya yajante śraddhayānvitāḥ | teṣāṁ niṣṭhā tu kā kṛṣṇa sattvam āho rajas tamaḥ ||

translations.english: Arjuna said: O Kṛṣṇa, what is the state of those who worship with faith but disregard the injunctions of the scriptures? Is it Sattva, Rajas, or Tamas?

verses.original: श्रीभगवानुवाच | त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा | सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु ||
verses.transliteration: śrībhagavān uvāca | tri-vidhā bhavati śraddhā dehināṁ sā svabhāva-jā | sāttvikī rājasī caiva tāmasī ceti tāṁ śṛṇu ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: The faith (śraddhā) of the embodied beings, born of their inherent nature (svabhāva), is of three kinds: Sāttvic (goodness), Rājasic (passion), and Tāmasic (ignorance). Hear about them now.

verses.original: सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत | श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्धः स एव सः ||
verses.transliteration: sattvānurūpā sarvasya śraddhā bhavati bhārata | śraddhāmayo 'yaṁ puruṣo yo yac-chraddhaḥ sa eva saḥ ||

translations.english: The faith of every person, O Bhārata, is according to their inherent nature (sattva). A person consists of their faith; whatever their faith is, that indeed is their being.

verses.original: यजन्ते सात्त्विका देवान्यक्षरक्षांसि राजसाः | प्रेतान्भूतगणांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तामसा जनाः ||
verses.transliteration: yajante sāttvikā devān yakṣa-rakṣāṁsi rājasāḥ | pretān bhūta-gaṇāṁś cānye yajante tāmasā janāḥ ||

translations.english: Sāttvic people worship the gods (devas); Rājasic people worship the demigods and demons (yakṣas and rakṣasas); and the Tāmasic people worship ghosts and spirits (pretas and bhūta-gaṇas).

verses.original: अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जनाः | दम्भाहङ्कारसंयुक्ताः कामरागबलान्विताः ||
verses.transliteration: aśāstra-vihitaṁ ghoraṁ tapyante ye tapo janāḥ | dambhāhaṅkāra-saṁyuktāḥ kāma-rāga-balānvitāḥ ||

translations.english: Those people who perform severe austerities not sanctioned by the scriptures, filled with hypocrisy and egoism, impelled by the force of lust and attachment...

verses.original: कर्षयन्तः शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतसः | मां चैवान्तःशरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान् ||
verses.transliteration: karṣayantaḥ śarīra-sthaṁ bhūta-grāmam acetasaḥ | māṁ caivāntaḥ-śarīra-sthaṁ tān viddhy āsura-niścayān ||

translations.english: ...who torment the elements (bhūta-grāma) residing in the body, and Me also, who dwell within the inner body—know these senseless people to be of a demonic nature.

verses.original: आहारस्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रियः | यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं तेषां भेदमिमं शृणु ||
verses.transliteration: āhāras tv api sarvasya tri-vidho bhavati priyaḥ | yajñas tapas tathā dānaṁ teṣāṁ bhedam imaṁ śṛṇu ||

translations.english: The food that is dear to all is also of three kinds. So too are sacrifice, austerity, and charity. Hear now the distinction of these.

verses.original: आयुःसत्त्वबलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धनाः | रस्याः स्निग्धाः स्थिरा हृद्या आहाराः सात्त्विकप्रियाः ||
verses.transliteration: āyuḥ-sattva-balārogya-sukha-prīti-vivardhanāḥ | rasyāḥ snigdhāḥ sthirā hṛdyā āhārāḥ sāttvika-priyāḥ ||

translations.english: Foods that increase life, purification (sattva), strength, health, happiness, and delight, and which are succulent, oily, substantial, and naturally pleasing—such foods are dear to Sāttvic persons.

verses.original: कट्वम्ललवणात्युष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिनः | आहारा राजसस्येष्टा दुःखशोकामयप्रदाः ||
verses.transliteration: kaṭv-amla-lavaṇāty-uṣṇa-tīkṣṇa-rūkṣa-vidāhinaḥ | āhārā rājasasyeṣṭā duḥkha-śokāmaya-pradāḥ ||

translations.english: Foods that are bitter, sour, salty, excessively hot, pungent, dry, and burning, which produce pain, grief, and disease, are desired by Rājasic persons.

verses.original: यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत् | उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम् ||
verses.transliteration: yāta-yāmaṁ gata-rasaṁ pūti paryuṣitaṁ ca yat | ucchiṣṭam api cāmedhyaṁ bhojanaṁ tāmasa-priyam ||

translations.english: That which is cooked three hours before being eaten, tasteless, putrid, stale, the leavings of others, and impure—such food is dear to Tāmasic persons.

verses.original: अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदृष्टो य इज्यते | यष्टव्यमेवेति मनः समाधाय स सात्त्विकः ||
verses.transliteration: aphalākāṅkṣibhir yajño vidhi-dṛṣṭo ya ijyate | yaṣṭavyam eveti manaḥ samādhāya sa sāttvikaḥ ||

translations.english: The sacrifice that is performed according to scriptural injunctions, by those who do not desire the results, and who fix their minds on the belief that 'it must be performed'—that is Sāttvic sacrifice.

verses.original: अभिसन्धाय तु फलं दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत् | इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम् ||
verses.transliteration: abhisandhāya tu phalaṁ dambhārtham api caiva yat | ijyate bharata-śreṣṭha taṁ yajñaṁ viddhi rājasam ||

translations.english: But that sacrifice which is performed with a desire for the results, and for the sake of show or hypocrisy, O best of the Bhāratas, know that sacrifice to be Rājasic.

verses.original: विधिहीनमसृष्टान्नं मन्त्रहीनमदक्षिणम् | श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते ||
verses.transliteration: vidhi-hīnam asṛṣṭānnaṁ mantra-hīnam adakṣiṇam | śraddhā-virahitaṁ yajñaṁ tāmasaṁ paricakṣate ||

translations.english: That sacrifice which is performed without scriptural injunctions, without distribution of food, without mantras, without gifts (dakṣiṇa) to priests, and without faith (śraddhā)—that is declared to be Tāmasic.

verses.original: देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम् | ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते ||
verses.transliteration: deva-dvija-guru-prājña-pūjanaṁ śaucam ārjavam | brahmacaryam ahiṁsā ca śārīraṁ tapa ucyate ||

translations.english: Worship of the gods, the twice-born, the gurus, and the wise; purity, straightforwardness, celibacy, and non-violence—these are called the austerity of the body (śārīraṁ tapa).

verses.original: अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत् | स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्मयं तप उच्यते ||
verses.transliteration: anudvegakaraṁ vākyaṁ satyaṁ priya-hitaṁ ca yat | svādhyāyābhyasanaṁ caiva vāṅmayaṁ tapa ucyate ||

translations.english: Speech that causes no disturbance, that is truthful, pleasant, and beneficial, as well as the regular recitation (study) of the Vedas—these are called the austerity of speech (vāṅmayaṁ tapa).

verses.original: मनःप्रसादः सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रहः | भावसंशुद्धिरित्येतत्तपो मानसमुच्यते ||
verses.transliteration: manaḥ-prasādaḥ saumyatvaṁ maunam ātma-vinigrahaḥ | bhāva-saṁśuddhir ity etat tapo mānasam ucyate ||

translations.english: Serenity of mind, gentleness, silence, self-control, and purity of disposition—these are called the austerity of the mind (mānasam tapa).

verses.original: श्रद्धया परया तप्तं तपस्तत्त्रिविधं नरैः | अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्युक्तैः सात्त्विकं परिचक्षते ||
verses.transliteration: śraddhayā parayā taptaṁ tapas tat tri-vidhaṁ naraiḥ | aphalākāṅkṣibhir yuktaiḥ sāttvikaṁ paricakṣate ||

translations.english: This three-fold austerity (of body, speech, and mind), performed with supreme faith by steady persons without desiring the fruits, is declared to be Sāttvic.

verses.original: सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत् | क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम् ||
verses.transliteration: satkāra-māna-pūjārthaṁ tapo dambhena caiva yat | kriyate tad iha proktaṁ rājasaṁ calam adhruvam ||

translations.english: That austerity which is performed for the sake of gaining respect, honor, and adoration, and also for the sake of hypocrisy—that is declared here to be Rājasic, unstable, and transient.

verses.original: मूढग्राहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तपः | परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||
verses.transliteration: mūḍha-grāheṇātmano yat pīḍayā kriyate tapaḥ | parasyotsādanārthaṁ vā tat tāmasam udāhṛtam ||

translations.english: That austerity which is performed with foolish obstinacy (mūḍha-grāheṇa), with self-torture, or for the purpose of destroying others—that is declared to be Tāmasic.

verses.original: दातव्यमिति यद्दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे | देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम् ||
verses.transliteration: dātavyam iti yad dānaṁ dīyate 'nupakāriṇe | deśe kāle ca pātre ca tad dānaṁ sāttvikaṁ smṛtam ||

translations.english: That charity which is given as a duty, without expectation of return, in a proper place, at a proper time, and to a worthy person—that charity is remembered as Sāttvic.

verses.original: यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुनः | दीयते च परिक्लिष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम् ||
verses.transliteration: yat tu pratyupakārārthaṁ phalam uddiśya vā punaḥ | dīyate ca parikliṣṭaṁ tad dānaṁ rājasaṁ smṛtam ||

translations.english: But that charity which is given with the hope of return, or expecting a reward, or grudgingly—that charity is remembered as Rājasic.

verses.original: अदेशकाले यद्दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते | असत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||
verses.transliteration: adeśa-kāle yad dānam apātrebhyaś ca dīyate | asat-kṛtam avajñātaṁ tat tāmasam udāhṛtam ||

translations.english: That charity which is given in an improper place or time, to unworthy persons, without respect, or with contempt—that is declared to be Tāmasic.

verses.original: ॐ तत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविधः स्मृतः | ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिताः पुरा ||
verses.transliteration: oṁ tat sad iti nirdeśo brahmaṇas tri-vidhaḥ smṛtaḥ | brāhmaṇās tena vedāś ca yajñāś ca vihitāḥ purā ||

translations.english: 'Om Tat Sat'—this is considered to be the threefold designation of Brahman. By this, the Brāhmaṇas, the Vedas, and the sacrifices were ordained in ancient times.

verses.original: तस्मादोमित्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतपःक्रियाः | प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ताः सततं ब्रह्मवादिनाम् ||
verses.transliteration: tasmād om ity udāhṛtya yajña-dāna-tapaḥ-kriyāḥ | pravartante vidhānoktāḥ satataṁ brahma-vādinām ||

translations.english: Therefore, with the utterance of 'Om', the acts of sacrifice, charity, and austerity, enjoined by scriptural rules, are always begun by the expounders of Brahman (the Vedas).

verses.original: तदित्यनभिसन्धाय फलं यज्ञतपःक्रियाः | दानक्रियाश्च विविधाः क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाङ्क्षिभिः ||
verses.transliteration: tad ity anabhisandhāya phalaṁ yajña-tapaḥ-kriyāḥ | dāna-kriyāś ca vividhāḥ kriyante mokṣa-kāṅkṣibhiḥ ||

translations.english: Uttering 'Tat' (meaning 'that Absolute'), those who desire liberation perform various acts of sacrifice, austerity, and charity without aiming for the fruit of action.

verses.original: सद्भावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत्प्रयुज्यते | प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्दः पार्थ युज्यते ||
verses.transliteration: sad-bhāve sādhu-bhāve ca sad ity etat prayujyate | praśaste karmaṇi tathā sac-chabdaḥ pārtha yujyate ||

translations.english: The word 'Sat' (meaning 'existence' or 'goodness') is used to express the sense of reality and the sense of goodness. Likewise, O son of Pṛthā, the word 'Sat' is applied to an auspicious action.

verses.original: यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थितिः सदिति चोच्यते | कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते ||
verses.transliteration: yajñe tapasi dāne ca sthitiḥ sad iti cocyate | karma caiva tad-arthīyaṁ sad ity evābhidhīyate ||

translations.english: Steadfastness in sacrifice, austerity, and charity is also called 'Sat'. And any action performed for the sake of the Supreme (God) is certainly designated as 'Sat'.

verses.original: अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत् | असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह ||
verses.transliteration: aśraddhayā hutaṁ dattaṁ tapas taptaṁ kṛtaṁ ca yat | asad ity ucyate pārtha na ca tat pretya no iha ||

translations.english: Whatever is offered in sacrifice, given in charity, or performed as austerity, or any action performed without faith (aśraddhayā), O son of Pṛthā, is declared to be 'Asat' (non-existent, unreal). It is useless both in this life and the next.

chapters.name: Mokṣa Sannyāsa Yoga
chapters.summary: The Yoga of Liberation by Renunciation. This chapter is a grand synthesis of the entire Gita's teachings, focusing primarily on Sannyāsa (renunciation) and Tyāga (abandonment). Krishna distinguishes between the two types of renunciation based on the three guṇas, and classifies knowledge, action, the agent, intellect, firmness, and happiness based on these modes. He describes the duties of the four classes (Varṇas) and the path to perfection through one's own duty (Svadharma). The chapter concludes with Krishna’s final, most confidential teaching: surrender completely to Him, and the ultimate assurance of liberation and His grace.

verses.original: अर्जुन उवाच | संन्यासस्य महाबाहो तत्त्वमिच्छामि वेदितुम् | त्यागस्य च हृषीकेश पृथक्केशिनिषूदन ||
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca | saṁnyāsasya mahā-bāho tattvam icchāmi veditum | tyāgasya ca hṛṣīkeśa pṛthak keśi-niṣūdana ||

translations.english: Arjuna said: O mighty-armed (Kṛṣṇa), O Hṛṣīkeśa, O slayer of the demon Keśī, I desire to know the true nature of renunciation (saṁnyāsa) and abandonment (tyāga), distinguishing between them.

verses.original: श्रीभगवानुवाच | काम्यानां कर्मणां न्यासं संन्यासं कवयो विदुः | सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं प्राहुस्त्यागं विचक्षणाः ||
verses.transliteration: śrībhagavān uvāca | kāmyānāṁ karmaṇāṁ nyāsaṁ saṁnyāsaṁ kavayo viduḥ | sarva-karma-phala-tyāgaṁ prāhus tyāgaṁ vicakṣaṇāḥ ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: The sages know saṁnyāsa (renunciation) to be the complete abandonment of actions motivated by desire. The wise declare tyāga (abandonment) to be the renunciation of the fruits of all actions.

verses.original: त्याज्यं दोषवदित्येके कर्म प्राहुर्मनीषिणः | यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यमिति चापरे ||
verses.transliteration: tyājyaṁ doṣavad it-y eke karma prāhur manīṣiṇaḥ | yajña-dāna-tapaḥ-karma na tyājyam iti cāpare ||

translations.english: Some wise men say that action should be given up as faulty, while others say that acts of sacrifice, charity, and austerity should not be abandoned.

verses.original: निश्चयं शृणु मे तत्र त्यागे भरतसत्तम | त्यागो हि पुरुषव्याघ्र त्रिविधः सम्प्रकीर्तितः ||
verses.transliteration: niścayaṁ śṛṇu me tatra tyāge bharata-sattama | tyāgo hi puruṣa-vyāghra tri-vidhaḥ samprakīrtitaḥ ||

translations.english: O best of the Bhāratas, hear My final conclusion regarding abandonment (tyāga). O tiger among men, abandonment is declared to be of three kinds.

verses.original: यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यं कार्यमेव तत् | यज्ञो दानं तपश्चैव पावनानि मनीषिणाम् ||
verses.transliteration: yajña-dāna-tapaḥ-karma na tyājyaṁ kāryam eva tat | yajño dānaṁ tapaś caiva pāvanāni manīṣiṇām ||

translations.english: Acts of sacrifice, charity, and austerity should not be abandoned; they must be performed. For sacrifice, charity, and austerity are purifiers of the wise.

verses.original: एतान्यपि तु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलानि च | कर्तव्यानीति मे पार्थ निश्चितं मतमुत्तमम् ||
verses.transliteration: etāny api tu karmāṇi saṅgaṁ tyaktvā phalāni ca | kartavyānīti me pārtha niścitaṁ matam uttamam ||

translations.english: But even these actions must be performed, O son of Pṛthā, giving up attachment and the fruits. This is My certain and supreme conclusion.

verses.original: नियतस्य तु संन्यासः कर्मणो नोपपद्यते | मोहात्तस्य परित्यागस्तामसः परिकीर्तितः ||
verses.transliteration: niyatasya tu saṁnyāsaḥ karmaṇo nopapadyate | mohāt tasya parityāgas tāmasaḥ parikīrtitaḥ ||

translations.english: The renunciation of prescribed duties (niyata karma) is not proper. The abandonment of such duty due to delusion is declared to be Tāmasic (in the mode of ignorance).

verses.original: दुःखमित्येव यत्कर्म कायक्लेशभयात्त्यजेत् | स कृत्वा राजसं त्यागं नैव त्यागफलं लभेत् ||
verses.transliteration: duḥkham it-y eva yat karma kāya-kleśa-bhayāt tyajet | sa kṛtvā rājasaṁ tyāgaṁ naiva tyāga-phalaṁ labhet ||

translations.english: He who gives up action merely because it is troublesome, through fear of physical exertion, performs a Rājasic abandonment and does not obtain the reward of true renunciation.

verses.original: कार्यमित्येव यत्कर्म नियतं क्रियतेऽर्जुन | सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलं चैव स त्यागः सात्त्विको मतः ||
verses.transliteration: kāryam it-y eva yat karma niyataṁ kriyate 'rjuna | saṅgaṁ tyaktvā phalaṁ caiva sa tyāgaḥ sāttviko mataḥ ||

translations.english: When an obligatory duty (niyata karma) is performed, O Arjuna, merely because it ought to be done, giving up attachment and also the fruit—that abandonment is considered Sāttvic.

verses.original: न द्वेष्ट्यकुशलं कर्म कुशले नानुषज्जते | त्यागी सत्त्वसमाविष्टो मेधावी छिन्नसंशयः ||
verses.transliteration: na dveṣṭy akuśalaṁ karma kuśale nānuṣajjate | tyāgī sattva-samāviṣṭo medhāvī chinna-saṁśayaḥ ||

translations.english: The person of Sāttvic abandonment, who is endowed with purity (sattva), intelligent, and whose doubts are dispelled, neither hates unpleasant action nor is attached to pleasant action.

verses.original: न हि देहभृता शक्यं त्यक्तुं कर्माण्यशेषतः | यस्तु कर्मफलत्यागी स त्यागीत्यभिधीयते ||
verses.transliteration: na hi deha-bhṛtā śakyaṁ tyaktuṁ karmāṇy aśeṣataḥ | yas tu karma-phala-tyāgī sa tyāgīty abhidhīyate ||

translations.english: It is indeed impossible for an embodied being to renounce all actions completely. But he who renounces the fruits of action is called a true abandoner (tyāgī).

verses.original: अनिष्टमिष्टं मिश्रं च त्रिविधं कर्मणः फलम् | भवत्यत्यागिनां प्रेत्य न तु संन्यासिनां क्वचित् ||
verses.transliteration: aniṣṭam iṣṭaṁ miśraṁ ca tri-vidhaṁ karmaṇaḥ phalam | bhavaty atyāgināṁ pretya na tu saṁnyāsināṁ kvacit ||

translations.english: Undesirable, desirable, and mixed—these are the three kinds of results of action that accrue after death to those who do not renounce, but never to the true renunciates.

verses.original: पञ्चैतानि महाबाहो कारणानि निबोध मे | साङ्ख्ये कृतान्ते प्रोक्तानि सिद्धये सर्वकर्मणाम् ||
verses.transliteration: pañcaitāni mahā-bāho kāraṇāni nibodha me | sāṅkhye kṛtānte proktāni siddhaye sarva-karmaṇām ||

translations.english: O mighty-armed (Arjuna), learn from Me the five factors, as declared in the Sāṅkhya doctrine for the cessation of action, which are required for the accomplishment of all actions.

verses.original: अधिष्ठानं तथा कर्ता करणं च पृथग्विधम् | विविधाश्च पृथक्चेष्टा दैवं चैवात्र पञ्चमम् ||
verses.transliteration: adhiṣṭhānaṁ tathā kartā karaṇaṁ ca pṛthag-vidham | vividhāś ca pṛthak ceṣṭā daivaṁ caivātra pañcamam ||

translations.english: The seat (body), the agent (ego/sense of doer), the instruments (senses and mind), the various kinds of separate efforts (prāṇas/vitals), and fifthly, the presiding deity (Daiva, providence).

verses.original: शरीरवाङ्मनोभिर्यत्कर्म प्रारभते नरः | न्याय्यं वा विपरीतं वा पञ्चैते तस्य हेतवः ||
verses.transliteration: śarīra-vāṅ-manobhir yat karma prārabhate naraḥ | nyāyyaṁ vā viparītaṁ vā pañcaite tasya hetavaḥ ||

translations.english: Whatever action a man undertakes with his body, speech, and mind—whether right or wrong—these five are its causes.

verses.original: तत्रैवं सति कर्तारमात्मानं केवलं तु यः | पश्यत्यकृतबुद्धित्वान्न स पश्यति दुर्मतिः ||
verses.transliteration: tatraivaṁ sati kartāram ātmānaṁ kevalaṁ tu yaḥ | paśyaty akṛta-buddhitvān na sa paśyati durmatiḥ ||

translations.english: This being the case, he who, due to his untrained intellect, sees only his Self (Ātman) as the sole agent, that ignorant person does not see rightly.

verses.original: यस्य नाहङ्कृतो भावो बुद्धिर्यस्य न लिप्यते | हत्वापि स इमाँल्लोकान्न हन्ति न निबध्यते ||
verses.transliteration: yasya nāhaṅkṛto bhāvo buddhir yasya na lipyate | hatvāpi sa imāṁl lokān na hanti na nibadhyate ||

translations.english: He who is free from the egoistic notion 'I am the doer' (ahaṅkṛta-bhāva), and whose intellect is not tainted (by the results), even though he kills these people, he neither kills nor is bound (by the action).

verses.original: ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं परिज्ञाता त्रिविधा कर्मचोदना | करणं कर्म कर्तेति त्रिविधः कर्मसङ्ग्रहः ||
verses.transliteration: jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ parijñātā tri-vidhā karma-codanā | karaṇaṁ karma karteti tri-vidhaḥ karma-saṅgrahaḥ ||

translations.english: Knowledge, the object of knowledge, and the knower—these are the threefold incitement to action. The instrument (karaṇa), the action (karma), and the agent (kartā)—these are the threefold components of action.

verses.original: ज्ञानं कर्म च कर्ता च त्रिधैव गुणभेदतः | प्रोच्यते गुणसङ्ख्याने यथावच्छृणु तान्यपि ||
verses.transliteration: jñānaṁ karma ca kartā ca tridhaiva guṇa-bhedataḥ | procyate guṇa-saṅkhyāne yathāvac chṛṇu tāny api ||

translations.english: Knowledge, action, and the agent are also said to be of three kinds, based on the distinction of the guṇas (qualities), in the science of the qualities. Hear them accurately.

verses.original: सर्वभूतेषु येनैकं भावमव्ययमीक्षते | अविभक्तं विभक्तेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि सात्त्विकम् ||
verses.transliteration: sarva-bhūteṣu yenaikaṁ bhāvam avyayam īkṣate | avibhaktaṁ vibhakteṣu taj jñānaṁ viddhi sāttvikam ||

translations.english: That knowledge by which one sees the one indestructible reality in all beings, undivided in the midst of division—know that knowledge to be Sāttvic (in the mode of goodness).

verses.original: पृथक्त्वेन तु यज्ज्ञानं नानाभावान्पृथग्विधान् | वेत्ति सर्वेषु भूतेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि राजसम् ||
verses.transliteration: pṛthaktvena tu yaj jñānaṁ nānā-bhāvān pṛthag-vidhān | vetti sarveṣu bhūteṣu taj jñānaṁ viddhi rājasam ||

translations.english: But that knowledge by which one sees in all beings various kinds of different entities (separated by nature and form)—know that knowledge to be Rājasic (in the mode of passion).

verses.original: यत्त कृत्स्नवदेकस्मिन्कार्ये सक्तमहैतुकम् | अतत्त्वार्थवदल्पं च तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||
verses.transliteration: yat tu kṛtsnavad ekasmin kārye saktam ahaitukam | atat-tvārthavad alpaṁ ca tat tāmasam udāhṛtam ||

translations.english: And that knowledge which clings to one single effect as if it were the whole, without reason, baseless, and meager in scope, is declared to be Tāmasic (in the mode of ignorance).

verses.original: नियतं सङ्गरहितमरागद्वेषतः कृतम् | अफलप्रेप्सुना कर्म यत्तत्सात्त्विकमुच्यते ||
verses.transliteration: niyataṁ saṅga-rahitam arāga-dveṣataḥ kṛtam | aphala-prepsunā karma yat tat sāttvikam ucyate ||

translations.english: Action that is obligatory, performed without attachment, without love or hatred, and by one who desires no fruit—that action is called Sāttvic.

verses.original: यत्तु कामेप्सुना कर्म साहङ्कारेण वा पुनः | क्रियते बहुलायासं तद्राजसमुदाहृतम् ||
verses.transliteration: yat tu kāmepsunā karma sāhaṅkāreṇa vā punaḥ | kriyate bahulāyāsaṁ tad rājasam udāhṛtam ||

translations.english: But that action which is performed by one desiring enjoyment of results, or with a sense of egoism, and involving great effort—that is declared to be Rājasic.

verses.original: अनुबन्धं क्षयं हिंसामनपेक्ष्य च पौरुषम् | मोहादारभ्यते कर्म यत्तत्तामसमुच्यते ||
verses.transliteration: anubandhaṁ kṣayaṁ hiṁsām anapekṣya ca pauruṣam | mohād ārabhyate karma yat tat tāmasam ucyate ||

translations.english: That action which is undertaken through delusion, without regard for consequences, loss, injury, or one's own capability—that is called Tāmasic.

verses.original: मुक्तसङ्गोऽनहंवादी धृत्युत्साहसमन्वितः | सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योर्निर्विकारः कर्ता सात्त्विक उच्यते ||
verses.transliteration: mukta-saṅgo 'nahaṁ-vādī dhṛty-utsāha-samanvitaḥ | sid-dhy asid-dhyor nirvikāraḥ kartā sāttvika ucyate ||

translations.english: The agent who is free from attachment, without the sense of 'I am the doer,' endowed with firmness and enthusiasm, and unaffected by success or failure—that agent is called Sāttvic.

verses.original: रागी कर्मफलप्रेप्सुर्लुब्धो हिंसात्मकोऽशुचिः | हर्षशोकान्वितः कर्ता राजसः परिकीर्तितः ||
verses.transliteration: rāgī karma-phala-prepsur lubdho hiṁsātmako 'śuciḥ | harṣa-śokānvitaḥ kartā rājasaḥ parikīrtitaḥ ||

translations.english: The agent who is passionate, desirous of the fruits of action, greedy, injurious, impure, and moved by joy and sorrow—that agent is declared to be Rājasic.

verses.original: अयुक्तः प्राकृतः स्तब्धः शठो नैष्कृतिकोऽलसः | विषादी दीर्घसूत्री च कर्ता तामस उच्यते ||
verses.transliteration: ayuktaḥ prākṛtaḥ stabdhaḥ śaṭho naiṣkṛtiko 'lasaḥ | viṣādī dīrgha-sūtrī ca kartā tāmasa ucyate ||

translations.english: The agent who is undisciplined, vulgar, obstinate, deceitful, malicious, lazy, despondent, and procrastinating—that agent is called Tāmasic.

verses.original: बुद्धेर्भेदं धृतेश्चैव गुणतस्त्रिविधं शृणु | प्रोच्यमानमशेषेण पृथक्त्वेन धनञ्जय ||
verses.transliteration: buddher bhedaṁ dhṛteś caiva guṇatas tri-vidhaṁ śṛṇu | procyamānam aśeṣeṇa pṛthaktvena dhanañjaya ||

translations.english: O Dhanañjaya, now hear the threefold distinction of intellect (buddhi) and firmness (dhṛti), according to the qualities (guṇas), which I shall describe completely and separately.

verses.original: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च कार्याकार्ये भयाभये | बन्धं मोक्षं च या वेत्ति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी ||
verses.transliteration: pravṛttiṁ ca nivṛttiṁ ca kāryā-kārye bhayābhaye | bandhaṁ mokṣaṁ ca yā vetti buddhiḥ sā pārtha sāttvikī ||

translations.english: That intellect which knows the path of action and the path of renunciation, what ought to be done and what ought not to be done, fear and fearlessness, and bondage and liberation—that intellect, O son of Pṛthā, is Sāttvic.

verses.original: यया धर्ममधर्मं च कार्यं चाकार्यमेव च | अयथावत्प्रजानाति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ राजसी ||
verses.transliteration: yayā dharmam adharmaṁ ca kāryaṁ cākāryam eva ca | ayathāvat prajānāti buddhiḥ sā pārtha rājasī ||

translations.english: That intellect by which one wrongly understands Dharma and Adharma (righteousness and unrighteousness), and what should be done and what should not be done—that intellect, O son of Pṛthā, is Rājasic.

verses.original: अधर्मं धर्ममिति या मन्यते तमसावृता | सर्वार्थान्विपरीतांश्च बुद्धिः सा पार्थ तामसी ||
verses.transliteration: adharmaṁ dharmam iti yā manyate tamasāvṛtā | sarvārthān viparītāṁś ca buddhiḥ sā pārtha tāmasī ||

translations.english: That intellect which is covered by darkness (Tamas) and considers Adharma to be Dharma, and views all things in a perverted way—that intellect, O son of Pṛthā, is Tāmasic.

verses.original: धृत्या यया धारयते मनःप्राणेन्द्रियक्रियाः | योगेनाव्यभिचारिण्या धृतिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी ||
verses.transliteration: dhṛtyā yayā dhārayate manaḥ-prāṇe-ndriya-kriyāḥ | yogenāvyabhicāriṇyā dhṛtiḥ sā pārtha sāttvikī ||

translations.english: That firmness (dhṛti) by which one steadily holds the functions of the mind, breath (prāṇa), and senses through unswerving Yoga—that firmness, O son of Pṛthā, is Sāttvic.

verses.original: यया तु धर्मकामार्थान्धृत्या धारयतेऽर्जुन | प्रसङ्गेन फलाकाङ्क्षी धृतिः सा पार्थ राजसी ||
verses.transliteration: yayā tu dharma-kāmārthān dhṛtyā dhārayate 'rjuna | prasaṅgena phalākāṅkṣī dhṛtiḥ sā pārtha rājasī ||

translations.english: But that firmness, O Arjuna, by which one holds fast to duty (Dharma), pleasure (Kāma), and wealth (Artha), with great attachment and a desire for results—that firmness, O son of Pṛthā, is Rājasic.

verses.original: यया स्वप्नं भयं शोकं विषादं मदमेव च | न विमुञ्चति दुर्मेधा धृतिः सा पार्थ तामसी ||
verses.transliteration: yayā svapnaṁ bhayaṁ śokaṁ viṣādaṁ madam eva ca | na vimuñcati durmedhā dhṛtiḥ sā pārtha tāmasī ||

translations.english: That firmness by which a dull-witted person does not give up sleep, fear, grief, despondency, and conceit—that firmness, O son of Pṛthā, is Tāmasic.

verses.original: सुखं त्विदानीं त्रिविधं शृणु मे भरतर्षभ | अभ्यासाद्रमते यत्र दुःखान्तं च निगच्छति ||
verses.transliteration: sukhaṁ tv idānīṁ tri-vidhaṁ śṛṇu me bharatarṣabha | abhyāsād ramate yatra duḥkhāntaṁ ca nigacchati ||

translations.english: Now hear from Me, O best of the Bhāratas, the three kinds of happiness (sukha), that which one enjoys through practice, and by which one comes to the end of suffering.

verses.original: यत्तदग्रे विषमिव परिणामेऽमृतोपमम् | तत्सुखं सात्त्विकं प्रोक्तमात्मबुद्धिप्रसादजम् ||
verses.transliteration: yat tad agre viṣam iva pariṇāme 'mṛtopamam | tat sukhaṁ sāttvikaṁ proktam ātma-buddhi-prasāda-jam ||

translations.english: That which is like poison at first, but like nectar at the end—that happiness is declared to be Sāttvic, born of the serenity of one's own intellect.

verses.original: विषयेन्द्रियसंयोगाद्यत्तदग्रेऽमृतोपमम् | परिणामे विषमिव तत्सुखं राजसं स्मृतम् ||
verses.transliteration: viṣaye-ndriya-saṁyogād yat tad agre 'mṛtopamam | pariṇāme viṣam iva tat sukhaṁ rājasaṁ smṛtam ||

translations.english: That happiness which arises from the contact of the senses with their objects, which is like nectar at first but like poison at the end—that happiness is considered Rājasic.

verses.original: यदग्रे चानुबन्धे च सुखं मोहनमात्मनः | निद्रालस्यप्रमादोत्थं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||
verses.transliteration: yad agre cānubandhe ca sukhaṁ mohanam ātmanaḥ | nidrālasya-pramādotthaṁ tat tāmasam udāhṛtam ||

translations.english: That happiness which deludes the self both at the beginning and the consequence, arising from sleep, laziness, and heedlessness—that is declared to be Tāmasic.

verses.original: न तदस्ति पृथिव्यां वा दिवि देवेषु वा पुनः | सत्त्वं प्रकृतिजैर्मुक्तं यदेभिः स्यात्त्रिभिर्गुणैः ||
verses.transliteration: na tad asti pṛthivyāṁ vā divi deveṣu vā punaḥ | sattvaṁ prakṛti-jair muktaṁ yad ebhiḥ syāt tribhir guṇaiḥ ||

translations.english: There is no being on earth, or again among the gods in heaven, that is free from these three qualities (guṇas) born of Nature (Prakṛti).

verses.original: ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियविशां शूद्राणां च परन्तप | कर्माणि प्रविभक्तानि स्वभावप्रभवैर्गुणैः ||
verses.transliteration: brāhmaṇa-kṣatriya-viśāṁ śūdrāṇāṁ ca paraṁtapa | karmāṇi pravibhaktāni svabhāva-prabhavair guṇaiḥ ||

translations.english: The duties of the Brāhmaṇas, Kṣatriyas, Vaiśyas, and Śūdras are distinctly divided, O scorcher of foes (Arjuna), according to the qualities born of their own nature (svabhāva).

verses.original: शमो दमस्तपः शौचं क्षान्तिरार्जवमेव च | ज्ञानं विज्ञानमास्तिक्यं ब्रह्मकर्म स्वभावजम् ||
verses.transliteration: śamo damas tapaḥ śaucaṁ kṣāntir ārjavam eva ca | jñānaṁ vijñānam āstikyaṁ brahma-karma svabhāva-jam ||

translations.english: Serenity, self-control, austerity, purity, forbearance, and uprightness, knowledge, wisdom, and faith in the Supreme—these are the duties of the Brāhmaṇas, born of their own nature.

verses.original: शौर्यं तेजो धृतिर्दाक्ष्यं युद्धे चाप्यपलायनम् | दानमीश्वरभावश्च क्षात्रं कर्म स्वभावजम् ||
verses.transliteration: śauryaṁ tejo dhṛtir dākṣyaṁ yuddhe cāpy apalāyanam | dānam īśvara-bhāvaś ca kṣātraṁ karma svabhāva-jam ||

translations.english: Heroism, vigor, firmness, dexterity, not running away from battle, generosity, and a lordly nature—these are the duties of the Kṣatriyas, born of their own nature.

verses.original: कृषिगौरक्ष्यवाणिज्यं वैश्यकर्म स्वभावजम् | परिचर्यात्मकं कर्म शूद्रस्यापि स्वभावजम् ||
verses.transliteration: kṛṣi-gau-rakṣya-vāṇijyaṁ vaiśya-karma svabhāva-jam | paricaryātmakaṁ karma śūdrasyāpi svabhāva-jam ||

translations.english: Agriculture, cow protection, and trade are the duties of the Vaiśyas, born of their own nature. And work consisting of service is the duty of the Śūdras, also born of their own nature.

verses.original: स्वे स्वे कर्मण्यभिरतः संसिद्धिं लभते नरः | स्वकर्मनिरतः सिद्धिं यथा विन्दति तच्छृणु ||
verses.transliteration: sve sve karmaṇy abhirataḥ saṁsiddhiṁ labhate naraḥ | sva-karma-nirataḥ siddhiṁ yathā vindati tac chṛṇu ||

translations.english: A man attains perfection by being devoted to his own duty. Hear now how one devoted to his own duty achieves perfection.

verses.original: यतः प्रवृत्तिर्भूतानां येन सर्वमिदं ततम् | स्वकर्मणा तमभ्यर्च्य सिद्धिं विन्दति मानवः ||
verses.transliteration: yataḥ pravṛttir bhūtānāṁ yena sarvam idaṁ tatam | sva-karmaṇā tam abhyarcya siddhiṁ vindati mānavaḥ ||

translations.english: A man attains perfection by worshiping through his own duty the One from whom all beings have originated and by whom this entire universe is pervaded.

verses.original: श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् | स्वभावनियतं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम् ||
verses.transliteration: śreyān sva-dharmo viguṇaḥ para-dharmāt svanuṣṭhitāt | svabhāva-niyataṁ karma kurvan nāpnoti kilbiṣam ||

translations.english: It is better to perform one's own prescribed duty, even imperfectly, than another's duty perfectly. By performing the duty prescribed by one's own nature, one incurs no sin.

verses.original: सहजं कर्म कौन्तेय सदोषमपि न त्यजेत् | सर्वारम्भा हि दोषेण धूमेनाग्निरिवावृताः ||
verses.transliteration: sahajaṁ karma kaunteya sa-doṣam api na tyajet | sarvārambhā hi doṣeṇa dhūmenāgnir ivāvṛtāḥ ||

translations.english: One should not abandon the duty born of his nature (sahajaṁ karma), O son of Kuntī, even if it has defects, for all undertakings are covered by defects, just as fire is covered by smoke.

verses.original: असक्तबुद्धिः सर्वत्र जितात्मा विगतस्पृहः | नैष्कर्म्यसिद्धिं परमां संन्यासेनाधिगच्छति ||
verses.transliteration: asakta-buddhiḥ sarvatra jitātmā vigata-spṛhaḥ | naiṣkarmya-siddhiṁ paramāṁ saṁnyāsenādhigacchati ||

translations.english: He whose intellect is unattached everywhere, who has conquered his self, and whose desires have vanished, attains by renunciation (saṁnyāsa) the supreme perfection of freedom from action (naiṣkarmya-siddhi).

verses.original: सिद्धिं प्राप्तो यथा ब्रह्म तथाप्नोति निबोध मे | समासेनैव कौन्तेय निष्ठा ज्ञानस्य या परा ||
verses.transliteration: siddhiṁ prāpto yathā brahma tathāpnoti nibodha me | samāsenaiva kaunteya niṣṭhā jñānasya yā parā ||

translations.english: O son of Kuntī, learn from Me briefly how one who has attained perfection (siddhi) reaches Brahman, which is the supreme culmination of knowledge.

verses.original: बुद्ध्या विशुद्धया युक्तो धृत्यात्मानं नियम्य च | शब्दादीन्विषयांस्त्यक्त्वा रागद्वेषौ व्युदस्य च ||
verses.transliteration: buddhyā viśuddhāyā yukto dhṛtyātmānaṁ niyamya ca | śabdādīn viṣayāṁs tyaktvā rāga-dveṣau vyudasya ca ||

translations.english: Endowed with a purified intellect, controlling the self with firmness, giving up the objects of the senses like sound, and casting aside attraction and aversion...

verses.original: विविक्तसेवी लघ्वाशी यतवाक्कायमानसः | ध्यानयोगपरो नित्यं वैराग्यं समुपाश्रितः ||
verses.transliteration: vivikta-sevī laghv-āśī yata-vāk-kāya-mānasaḥ | dhyāna-yoga-paro nityaṁ vairāgyaṁ samupāśritaḥ ||

translations.english: ...resorting to solitude, eating lightly, controlling speech, body, and mind, constantly engaged in meditation (Dhyāna Yoga), and taking refuge in detachment...

verses.original: अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं परिग्रहम् | विमुच्य निर्ममः शान्तो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ||
verses.transliteration: ahaṅkāraṁ balaṁ darpaṁ kāmaṁ krodhaṁ parigraham | vimucya nirmamaḥ śānto brahma-bhūyāya kalpate ||

translations.english: ...having given up egoism, strength, arrogance, desire, anger, and possessiveness, free from the sense of 'mine' (nirmamaḥ), and peaceful—he is fit for becoming one with Brahman.

verses.original: ब्रह्मभूतः प्रसन्नात्मा न शोचति न काङ्क्षति | समः सर्वेषु भूतेषु मद्भक्तिं लभते पराम् ||
verses.transliteration: brahma-bhūtaḥ prasannātmā na śocati na kāṅkṣati | samaḥ sarveṣu bhūteṣu mad-bhaktiṁ labhate parām ||

translations.english: Having become one with Brahman (Brahma-bhūtaḥ), serene in the Self, he neither grieves nor desires; being impartial to all beings, he attains supreme devotion to Me.

verses.original: भक्त्या मामभिजानाति यावान्यश्चास्मि तत्त्वतः | ततो मां तत्त्वतो ज्ञात्वा विशते तदनन्तरम् ||
verses.transliteration: bhaktyā mām abhijānāti yāvān yaś cāsmi tattvataḥ | tato māṁ tattvato jñātvā viśate tad anantaram ||

translations.english: Through devotion, he truly comes to know Me, who I am and what I am in essence. Then, having known Me in truth, he enters into Me immediately after.

verses.original: सर्वकर्माण्यपि सदा कुर्वाणो मद्व्यपाश्रयः | मत्प्रसादादवाप्नोति शाश्वतं पदमव्ययम् ||
verses.transliteration: sarva-karmāṇy api sadā kurvāṇo mad-vyapāśrayaḥ | mat-prasādād avāpnoti śāśvataṁ padam avyayam ||

translations.english: Even while always performing all actions, by taking refuge in Me, he attains, by My grace, the eternal, imperishable abode.

verses.original: चेतसा सर्वकर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्परः | बुद्धियोगमुपाश्रित्य मच्चित्तः सततं भव ||
verses.transliteration: cetasā sarva-karmāṇi mayi saṁnyasya mat-paraḥ | buddhi-yogam upāśritya mac-cittaḥ satataṁ bhava ||

translations.english: Mentally renouncing all actions in Me, regarding Me as the supreme goal, and resorting to the Yoga of the Intellect (Buddhi Yoga), be constantly fixed in consciousness of Me.

verses.original: मच्चित्तः सर्वदुर्गाणि मत्प्रसादात्तरिष्यसि | अथ चेत्त्वमहङ्कारान्न श्रोष्यसि विनङ्क्ष्यसि ||
verses.transliteration: mac-cittaḥ sarva-durgāṇi mat-prasādāt tariṣyasi | atha cet tvam ahaṅkārān na śroṣyasi vinaṅkṣyasi ||

translations.english: Being conscious of Me, you will overcome all obstacles by My grace. But if, due to egoism, you will not listen, you will perish.

verses.original: यदहङ्कारमाश्रित्य न योत्स्य इति मन्यसे | मिथ्यैष व्यवसायस्ते प्रकृतिस्त्वां नियोक्ष्यति ||
verses.transliteration: yad ahaṅkāram āśritya na yotsya iti manyase | mithy-aiṣa vyavasāyas te prakṛtis tvāṁ niyokṣyati ||

translations.english: If, relying on egoism, you think, 'I will not fight,' this resolve of yours is vain. Your own Nature (Prakṛti) will compel you.

verses.original: स्वभावजेन कौन्तेय निबद्धः स्वेन कर्मणा | कर्तुं नेच्छसि यन्मोहात्करिष्यस्यवशोऽपि तत् ||
verses.transliteration: svabhāva-jena kaunteya nibad-dhaḥ svena karmaṇā | kartuṁ necchasi yan mohāt kariṣyasy avaśo 'pi tat ||

translations.english: O son of Kuntī, bound by your own action born of your nature, what you do not wish to do out of delusion, you will do even against your will.

verses.original: ईश्वरः सर्वभूतानां हृद्देशेऽर्जुन तिष्ठति | भ्रामयन्सर्वभूतानि यन्त्रारूढानि मायया ||
verses.transliteration: īśvaraḥ sarva-bhūtānāṁ hṛd-deśe 'rjuna tiṣṭhati | bhrāmayān sarva-bhūtāni yantrārūḍhāni māyayā ||

translations.english: The Lord (Īśvara) resides in the region of the heart of all beings, O Arjuna, revolving all beings, which are mounted on the machine (body) by His māyā (illusory power).

verses.original: तमेव शरणं गच्छ सर्वभावेन भारत | तत्प्रसादात्परां शान्तिं स्थानं प्राप्स्यसि शाश्वतम् ||
verses.transliteration: tam eva śaraṇaṁ gaccha sarva-bhāvena bhārata | tat-prasādāt parāṁ śāntiṁ sthānaṁ prāpsyasi śāśvatam ||

translations.english: Seek refuge in Him alone with your whole being, O Bhārata. By His grace, you will obtain supreme peace and the eternal abode.

verses.original: इति ते ज्ञानमाख्यातं गुह्याद्गुह्यतरं मया | विमृश्यैतदशेषेण यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु ||
verses.transliteration: iti te jñānam ākhyātaṁ guhyād guhyataraṁ mayā | vimṛśyaitad aśeṣeṇa yathecchasi tathā kuru ||

translations.english: Thus, this knowledge, more secret than all secrets, has been declared to you by Me. Reflect upon it completely, and then act as you wish.

verses.original: सर्वगुह्यतमं भूयः शृणु मे परमं वचः | इष्टोऽसि मे दृढमिति ततो वक्ष्यामि ते हितम् ||
verses.transliteration: sarva-guhyatamaṁ bhūyaḥ śṛṇu me paramaṁ vacaḥ | iṣṭo 'si me dṛḍham iti tato vakṣyāmi te hitam ||

translations.english: Hear again My supreme word, the most confidential of all. You are very dear to Me; therefore, I shall tell you what is good for you.

verses.original: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु | मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे ||
verses.transliteration: man-manā bhava mad-bhakto mad-yājī māṁ namas-kuru | mām evaiṣyasi satyaṁ te pratijāne priyo 'si me ||

translations.english: Fix your mind on Me, be devoted to Me, worship Me, and offer homage to Me. You will surely come to Me. I promise you this, for you are dear to Me.

verses.original: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज | अहं त्वा सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः ||
verses.transliteration: sarva-dharmān parityajya mām ekaṁ śaraṇaṁ vraja | ahaṁ tvā sarva-pāpebhyo mokṣayiṣyāmi mā śucaḥ ||

translations.english: Abandon all varieties of duties (dharmas) and surrender unto Me alone. I shall liberate you from all sinful reactions; do not despair (do not fear).

verses.original: इदं ते नातपस्काय नाभक्ताय कदाचन | न चाशुश्रूषवे वाच्यं न च मां योऽभ्यसूयति ||
verses.transliteration: idaṁ te nātapaskāya nābhaktāya kadācana | na cāśuśrūṣave vācyaṁ na ca māṁ yo 'bhyasūyati ||

translations.english: This (teaching) should never be spoken by you to one who is not ascetic, nor to one who is not devoted, nor to one who does not desire to hear, nor to one who speaks ill of Me.

verses.original: य इदं परमं गुह्यं मद्भक्तेष्वभिधास्यति | भक्तिं मयि परां कृत्वा मामेवैष्यत्यसंशयः ||
verses.transliteration: ya idaṁ paramaṁ guhyaṁ mad-bhakteṣv abhidhāsyati | bhaktiṁ mayi parāṁ kṛtvā mām evaiṣyaty asaṁśayaḥ ||

translations.english: He who explains this supreme secret to My devotees, establishing supreme devotion to Me, will surely come to Me; there is no doubt.

verses.original: न च तस्मान्मनुष्येषु कश्चिन्मे प्रियकृत्तमः | भविता न च मे तस्मादन्यः प्रियतरो भुवि ||
verses.transliteration: na ca tasmān manuṣyeṣu kaścin me priya-kṛttamaḥ | bhavitā na ca me tasmād anyaḥ priyataro bhuvi ||

translations.english: There is no one among men who performs a more pleasing service to Me, nor shall there be anyone dearer to Me on earth than he.

verses.original: अध्येष्यते च य इमं धर्म्यं संवादमावयोः | ज्ञानयज्ञेन तेनाहमिष्टः स्यामिति मे मतिः ||
verses.transliteration: adhyeṣyate ca ya imaṁ dharmyaṁ saṁvādam āvayoḥ | jñāna-yajñena tenāham iṣṭaḥ syām iti me matiḥ ||

translations.english: And he who studies this sacred dialogue of ours, by him I shall be worshiped through the sacrifice of knowledge (Jñāna-Yajña)—that is My opinion.

verses.original: श्रद्धावाननसूयश्च शृणुयादपि यो नरः | सोऽपि मुक्तः शुभाँल्लोकान्प्राप्नुयात्पुण्यकर्मणाम् ||
verses.transliteration: śraddhāvān anasūyaś ca śṛṇuyād api yo naraḥ | so 'pi muktaḥ śubhāṁl lokān prāpnuyāt puṇya-karmaṇām ||

translations.english: And the man who merely hears this with faith and without malice, even he, being liberated, attains the auspicious worlds of the virtuous.

verses.original: कच्चिदेतच्छ्रुतं पार्थ त्वयैकाग्रेण चेतसा | कच्चिदज्ञानसम्मोहः प्रनष्टस्ते धनञ्जय ||
verses.transliteration: kaccid etac chrutam pārtha tvay-aikāgreṇa cetasā | kaccid ajñāna-sammohaḥ pranaṣṭas te dhanañjaya ||

translations.english: O son of Pṛthā, have you heard this with an attentive mind? O Dhanañjaya, has the delusion of your ignorance been completely destroyed?

verses.original: अर्जुन उवाच | नष्टो मोहः स्मृतिर्लब्धा त्वत्प्रसादान्मयाच्युत | स्थितोऽस्मि गतसन्देहः करिष्ये वचनं तव ||
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca | naṣṭo mohaḥ smṛtir labdhā tvat-prasādān mayācyuta | sthito 'smi gata-sandehaḥ kariṣye vacanaṁ tava ||

translations.english: Arjuna said: My delusion is destroyed, and I have regained my memory through Your grace, O infallible One (Acyuta). I am firm, free from doubt, and I shall carry out Your instruction.

verses.original: सञ्जय उवाच | इत्यहं वासुदेवस्य पार्थस्य च महात्मनः | संवादमिममश्रौषमद्भुतं रोमहर्षणम् ||
verses.transliteration: sañjaya uvāca | it-y ahaṁ vāsudevasya pārthasya ca mahātmanaḥ | saṁvādam imam aśrauṣam adbhutaṁ roma-harṣaṇam ||

translations.english: Sañjaya said: Thus, I heard this wonderful and thrilling dialogue between Vāsudeva (Kṛṣṇa) and the great-souled son of Pṛthā (Arjuna).

verses.original: व्यासप्रसादाच्छ्रुतवानेतद्गुह्यमहं परम् | योगं योगेश्वरात्कृष्णात्साक्षात्कथयतः स्वयम् ||
verses.transliteration: vyāsa-prasādāc chrutavān etad guhyam ahaṁ param | yogaṁ yogeśvarāt kṛṣṇāt sākṣāt kathayataḥ svayam ||

translations.english: By the grace of Vyāsa, I have heard this supreme and most secret Yoga (teaching) directly from Kṛṣṇa, the Lord of Yoga, who was Himself speaking it.

verses.original: राजन्संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य संवादमिममद्भुतम् | केशवार्जुनयोः पुण्यं हृष्यामि च मुहुर्मुहुः ||
verses.transliteration: rājan saṁsmṛtya saṁsmṛtya saṁvādam imam adbhutam | keśavārjunayoḥ puṇyaṁ hṛṣyāmi ca muhur muhuḥ ||

translations.english: O King (Dhṛtarāṣṭra), remembering again and again this amazing and sacred dialogue between Keśava (Kṛṣṇa) and Arjuna, I rejoice repeatedly.

verses.original: तच्च संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य रूपमत्यद्भुतं हरेः | विस्मयो मे महान् राजन्हृष्यामि च पुन: पुन: ||
verses.transliteration: tac ca saṁsmṛtya saṁsmṛtya rūpam aty-adbhutaṁ hareḥ | vismayo me mahān rājan hṛṣyāmi ca punaḥ punaḥ ||

translations.english: And remembering again and again that most astonishing form of Hari (Kṛṣṇa), great wonder comes upon me, O King, and I rejoice again and again.

verses.original: यत्र योगेश्वरः कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धरः | तत्र श्रीर्विजयो भूतिर्ध्रुवा नीतिर्मतिर्मम ||
verses.transliteration: yatra yogeśvaraḥ kṛṣṇo yatra pārtho dhanur-dharaḥ | tatra śrīr vijayo bhūtir dhruvā nītir matir mama ||

translations.english: Where there is Kṛṣṇa, the Lord of Yoga, and where there is the son of Pṛthā (Arjuna), the wielder of the bow—there, I believe, will certainly be prosperity, victory, abundance, and righteousness.
